flavor: “To stagnate is to forget your purpose, to still is to die.Here you’ll live, each scar a mark of pride, each beat ofyour heart a melody all your own.”
name: Revenge
text: After you take a Wound, you may spend up to 2 AP as if it was your turn, all Actions you take when doing this count as Reactions.

flavor: “To stagnate is to forget your purpose, to still is to die.Here you’ll live, each scar a mark of pride, each beat ofyour heart a melody all your own.”
name: Cornered Dog
text: If you would receive an Effect, you may take 2 damage instead.

flavor: “To stagnate is to forget your purpose, to still is to die.Here you’ll live, each scar a mark of pride, each beat ofyour heart a melody all your own.”
name: Take A Beating
text: The first time you take damage each turn, gain 1 Focus. If that damage would deal a Wound to you, Charge at no Cost as a Reaction.

flavor: “I felt stupid for for my obvious awe, with the size of ourquarry I should have expected my hunt-mates bringingcomparable arms, but that… club? It was ridiculous,even more so with how he carried it. I wanted to make acomment, but with how the others greeted him it seemslike I’m the only one who would think it's strange.”
name: Speed Is Weight
text: If your Body Finisher is the first attack on your Turn, you gain 2 Focus and Shred your target before dealing damage.

flavor: “I felt stupid for for my obvious awe, with the size of ourquarry I should have expected my hunt-mates bringingcomparable arms, but that… club? It was ridiculous,even more so with how he carried it. I wanted to make acomment, but with how the others greeted him it seemslike I’m the only one who would think it's strange.”
name: Wide Arc
text: When spending 3 or more Focus on a Body Finisher, you can have it target enemies in a 2x2 Zone placed on yourself.

flavor: “I felt stupid for for my obvious awe, with the size of ourquarry I should have expected my hunt-mates bringingcomparable arms, but that… club? It was ridiculous,even more so with how he carried it. I wanted to make acomment, but with how the others greeted him it seemslike I’m the only one who would think it's strange.”
name: Titanic Heave [ Breathe → Body Finisher ]
text: The Finisher counts all dice rolled as Hits, pushes enemies it hits 2 spaces back, and Weakens you after it resolves.

flavor: “What’s wrong, can't draw blood? I remember you weretalking real big with all that “I’ll only need one strike”garbage. So go on. Strike me.”
name: Riposte [ Block → Skirmish ]
text: (Combos can be started off of your Turn so long as you don’t take any actions that would break it) The Skirmish lets you move 3 spaces before targeting and Taunts your target.

flavor: “What’s wrong, can't draw blood? I remember you weretalking real big with all that “I’ll only need one strike”garbage. So go on. Strike me.”
name: Parry
text: Your Blocks give [Tension] additional Armor Using Block against an adjacent character Dazes your Attacker and pushes them instead of you.

flavor: “What’s wrong, can't draw blood? I remember you weretalking real big with all that “I’ll only need one strike”garbage. So go on. Strike me.”
name: Deflecting Blow
text: After you Block an Attack and reduce its damage to 1 or less, you may spend 1 Focus to Strengthen yourself and Skirmish.

flavor: “LET IT RUN THROUGH YOUR BLOOD! FEEL YOURSYSTEM ERUPT! GIVE A FUCK WHAT YOU SAID!WE ALL LIE IN THE MUD!”
name: Effort
text: If you roll a 1 in any Challenge roll, you may reduce your Speed by 1 for the duration of the Scene (to a minimum of 1) to treat it as a 6 instead, converting it to a Critical Hit. If you cannot lower your Speed, you receive [Tier] damage instead.

flavor: “LET IT RUN THROUGH YOUR BLOOD! FEEL YOURSYSTEM ERUPT! GIVE A FUCK WHAT YOU SAID!WE ALL LIE IN THE MUD!”
name: Adrenaline
text: After you take damage on your Turn, you may move up to 3 spaces towards an enemy of your choice. If this brings you adjacent to the enemy, you may Mark them.

flavor: “LET IT RUN THROUGH YOUR BLOOD! FEEL YOURSYSTEM ERUPT! GIVE A FUCK WHAT YOU SAID!WE ALL LIE IN THE MUD!”
name: Defy Reason
text: You may use the effect of “Effort” on any roll that comes from a Finisher, regardless of value.

flavor: “Versatility is a power you can’t buy. It must be learnedthrough a complete mastery of all its parts.”
name: Twin Suns [ Cast → Skirmish ]
text: The Skirmish is Swift, and has its cost reduced to 0. When using it, you can Teleport to a space in 3 range before targeting.

flavor: “Versatility is a power you can’t buy. It must be learnedthrough a complete mastery of all its parts.”
name: Infused Edge
text: If you end a Combo in a non-Cast Attack, it becomes ‘Infused’. Infused attacks count as a Cast and let you Teleport to a space adjacent to your target after dealing damage, dealing additional damage equal to the Crits you rolled if you do.

flavor: “Versatility is a power you can’t buy. It must be learnedthrough a complete mastery of all its parts.”
name: Witch Hunter [ Cast → Body/Talent Finisher ]
text: If the Finisher targets the same character as the Cast, it deals [Spirit] additional damage.

flavor: “A fighter is not their body, but a collection oftechniques and experiences.”
name: Stretch
text: After you Charge, you ‘Stretch’. After Stretching, until the end of your next Turn, completing a Combo gives you 1 AP.

flavor: “A fighter is not their body, but a collection oftechniques and experiences.”
name: Perfect Form
text: After you complete a Combo, you gain 1 Armor until the start of your next Turn.

flavor: “A fighter is not their body, but a collection oftechniques and experiences.”
name: Final Blow [ Skirmish → Finisher ]
text: The Finisher costs 1 AP and pushes its target 3 spaces away.

flavor: “You weren't even worth cleaning the stains…”
name: Hubris
text:
Begin tracking ‘Pride’, a 6 Segment Clock that’s emptied after every Scene. After you do one of the following, fill one Segment of this Clock:
‣ Get hit by an enemy's Attack without using a Defensive Reaction.
‣ Attack rolling one of your two lowest Attributes. While your Pride Clock is full, you gain 1 Advantage on all Rolls for the remainder of the Scene.

flavor: “You weren't even worth cleaning the stains…”
name: Prove Yourself
text: If your Pride Clock fills, you may ‘Hold Back’, emptying the Clock and reducing its total Segments by 2 (to a min of 2). If your Pride Clock has less than 6 Segments, “Hubris” grants one additional Advantage for every two Segments it is less than 6.

flavor: “You weren't even worth cleaning the stains…”
name: A Worthy Opponent
text: When an enemy attacks you, you may fill a Pride Segment.

flavor: “A hundred pellets at 1600 feet per second hurts aboutas much as you would expect.”
name: Buck Shot
text: Your Skirmishes can Choose a target in 4 range instead of its normal targeting. Your Skirmishes Against targets in 2 range push the target 1 space away.

flavor: “A hundred pellets at 1600 feet per second hurts aboutas much as you would expect.”
name: Both Barrels
text: Before you Skirmish, so long as you're not Weakened, you can fire ‘Both Barrels’. Doing this gives the Attack [Body/2] Advantage, doubles any push it deals, and Weakens you after it resolves.

flavor: “A hundred pellets at 1600 feet per second hurts aboutas much as you would expect.”
name: Annihilate
text: Your Body Finisher can now target characters up to 3 spaces away and can use the effect of “Both Barrels”. If you use “Both Barrels” with a Skirmish or Body Finisher, have it target a 2x2 Zone adjacent to you.

flavor: “I’m pretty experienced myself y’know, 15 years of BajiQuan, 11 years of Aikido, and a semester of Capoeira.Oh, sorry. We should be dueling about now! I’ve got abad habit of bragging when I don’t think I’ll be seeingsomeone again.”
name: Art Of The 8 Hammers
text:
You can’t use any part of this Technique if you use Techniques with the "weapon" tag. After you Skirmish or Body / Talent Finisher, you can use one of the following ‘follow ups’ on one of your targets. Each can be used once per Round.
‣ Quick Step: Move up to 3 spaces. Gain [Tier] Evasion.
‣ Binding Blow: Snare your target.
‣ Rising Knee: Launch your target.
‣ Iron Shoulder: Push your target 3 spaces.

flavor: “I’m pretty experienced myself y’know, 15 years of BajiQuan, 11 years of Aikido, and a semester of Capoeira.Oh, sorry. We should be dueling about now! I’ve got abad habit of bragging when I don’t think I’ll be seeingsomeone again.”
name: Flow-State
text: Your first Skirmish each Turn is Swift. After you trigger an effect of “Art Of The 8 Hammers”, you may deal [Body / 2] or [Talent / 2] damage to a character you’ve attacked this Turn.

flavor: “I’m pretty experienced myself y’know, 15 years of BajiQuan, 11 years of Aikido, and a semester of Capoeira.Oh, sorry. We should be dueling about now! I’ve got abad habit of bragging when I don’t think I’ll be seeingsomeone again.”
name: Unlimited Blows
text: Your attacks gain 1 Advantage. If you roll at least one Crit on a Skirmish or Finisher, “Art Of The 8 Hammers” triggers an additional time.

flavor: Born under the twin stars, Qayid Āl-Rashid existed in astate of extremes; his life oscillating between terriblemisfortune and unforgettable opulence. It was only afterhe came of age that he learned to balance these chaoticforces, and channel them in battle.
name: Mind Made Manifest
text: While you’re Strengthened, gain 2 Armor. While you’re Hastened, gain 2 Evasion at the end of your Turn.

flavor: Born under the twin stars, Qayid Āl-Rashid existed in astate of extremes; his life oscillating between terriblemisfortune and unforgettable opulence. It was only afterhe came of age that he learned to balance these chaoticforces, and channel them in battle.
name: Calm Within Chaos
text: Begin tracking "balance", an 8 segment Clock that's emptied after every scene. Fill 1 segment each time you perform a Utility Action after an Attack Action, or an Attack Action after a Utility Action on the same Turn. At the start of your Turn, you may empty 1 segment to Strengthen or Hasten yourself.

flavor: Born under the twin stars, Qayid Āl-Rashid existed in astate of extremes; his life oscillating between terriblemisfortune and unforgettable opulence. It was only afterhe came of age that he learned to balance these chaoticforces, and channel them in battle.
name: Sublime Equanimity
text: After you Charge or Awaken this, you may ‘Meditate’. If you Meditate, instead of rolling, gain Evasion equal to the filled Balance segments, and then empty your Balance. If your balance was full, gain [Tier x 2] focus, teleport to any empty space, and perform a swift spirit or mind finisher on an adjacent enemy at no cost. After Meditating you cannot fill balance segments on the same Turn.

flavor: “I’ll take all you bastards on! I’ll flatten your wholedamned Pavilion! You’ll rue the day you slighted me!And the record will be written in your scars!”“Well… if I still had my sword. Until then, a concussionand some splinters will do.”
name: “This’ll Do”
text: You can Interact to ‘notice something’, creating an Obstacle in 5 range, or to remove adjacent Obstacle to make a Swift Skirmish or Cast using any Attribute for its Roll.

flavor: “I’ll take all you bastards on! I’ll flatten your wholedamned Pavilion! You’ll rue the day you slighted me!And the record will be written in your scars!”“Well… if I still had my sword. Until then, a concussionand some splinters will do.”
name: “That One Hurts!”
text: You may Interact at no cost and with Swift once per Round, so long as it doesn’t result in an Attack. Attacks from Interact have 3 Advantage.

flavor: “I’ll take all you bastards on! I’ll flatten your wholedamned Pavilion! You’ll rue the day you slighted me!And the record will be written in your scars!”“Well… if I still had my sword. Until then, a concussionand some splinters will do.”
name: Last Resort
text: Once per scene, you may Attack using “This’ll Do”, even if there isn’t an Obstacle to remove. This use gives the Attack from it [Tension] Advantage.

flavor: “My dearest brother, born on the battlefield. I know youexpect more, but I implore you. Lend me your strength,and feel the air on your skin. I call upon you in my timeof greatest need, heed, o’ Durandal!”
name: Heavenly Arm
text: Choose a Technique with the “Weapon” Tag. Once per Scene, After you Charge or Awaken this with at least 2 Tension, you may ‘Transform’, pushing all enemies within 2 range 3 spaces away and trigger any of its Deploy effects. While Transformed you count as having all three Levels of the Technique you chose, if it has an alternate Foci, track it separately and use it as your Focus while Transformed. If you’re reduced to 0 Health while Transformed, it ends, and you’re Dazed.

flavor: “My dearest brother, born on the battlefield. I know youexpect more, but I implore you. Lend me your strength,and feel the air on your skin. I call upon you in my timeof greatest need, heed, o’ Durandal!”
name: Esoteric Blades
text: Choose one other Technique of any kind, while you are transformed you count as having the first two Levels of that Technique.

flavor: “My dearest brother, born on the battlefield. I know youexpect more, but I implore you. Lend me your strength,and feel the air on your skin. I call upon you in my timeof greatest need, heed, o’ Durandal!”
name: Saintly Sword, Durandal
text: You may lose your Transformation before you use a finisher. If you do so, that Finisher can target all enemies along a ∞ space long Line, where at least one targeted space is adjacent to you, dealing one additional damage for each character it targeted. If you’re Tier 3 or higher you may Daze yourself and spend 2 Focus to transform as soon as you deploy regardless of Tension.

flavor: “Sorry, but it’s hard to tell exactly what he looked like. Iwas one of the later waves the Watchers sent out and atthat point the fog was coming in heavy. But I remembersomething, that thing seemed more animal than elf, Icould see the violet light of their eyes piercing throughthe fog, and I swear I could see pain fey trailing off theirwounds like a commander’s ribbons.”
name: Thrill
text: After you receive a Negative Effect, you may also Strengthen yourself.

flavor: “Sorry, but it’s hard to tell exactly what he looked like. Iwas one of the later waves the Watchers sent out and atthat point the fog was coming in heavy. But I remembersomething, that thing seemed more animal than elf, Icould see the violet light of their eyes piercing throughthe fog, and I swear I could see pain fey trailing off theirwounds like a commander’s ribbons.”
name: Wild Rush
text: The first time you Skirmish each Turn, before targeting, you may Blight yourself to move up to 2 spaces in a Line. If you’re already Blighted, Mark yourself instead and move up to 3 spaces. If the target’s Adjacent, you gain 1 Advantage for each space moved.

flavor: “Sorry, but it’s hard to tell exactly what he looked like. Iwas one of the later waves the Watchers sent out and atthat point the fog was coming in heavy. But I remembersomething, that thing seemed more animal than elf, Icould see the violet light of their eyes piercing throughthe fog, and I swear I could see pain fey trailing off theirwounds like a commander’s ribbons.”
name: Bled Dry
text: You are unaffected by Negative Effects, so long as you have 1 or more Wounds.

flavor: “Adept knights know their guns as well as they knowthemselves; each part maintained and accounted for.Famous knights just need to let shots fy.” l
name: Big Iron
text: You now use ‘Bullets’ instead of Focus. You start all Scenes with 6 Bullets. After you spend Bullets, you may deal 1 damage to an enemy within 4 range once per bullet spent. Before you Skirmish you may spend any number of Bullets to have it target characters you deal bullet damage to.

flavor: “Adept knights know their guns as well as they knowthemselves; each part maintained and accounted for.Famous knights just need to let shots fy.” l
name: Lock And Load
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. If you end your turn without spending a Bullet, you can set your Bullets to 6.

flavor: “Adept knights know their guns as well as they knowthemselves; each part maintained and accounted for.Famous knights just need to let shots fy.” l
name: Bullet Juggle
text: Your attacks that roll 2 or more Crits Launch a target of your choice. Your bonus damage from “Big Iron” is doubled against Launched characters.

flavor: “You must not give in! You cannot! Claw and bite like acornered rat! It’s the only option you have left.”
name: Get Back Up
text: Once per Chapter, you may spend an Influence to put it On The Line at no cost. Doing this makes you lose the ability to gain Influence for the remainder of the Scene.

flavor: “You must not give in! You cannot! Claw and bite like acornered rat! It’s the only option you have left.”
name: Furious Revival
text: After you spend an Influence in a combat Scene, you may take an Action with a cost of 1 for no cost with Swift.

flavor: “You must not give in! You cannot! Claw and bite like acornered rat! It’s the only option you have left.”
name: Phoenix
text: After you put it On The Line using “Get Back Up” you may set your Wounds to 1.

flavor: “My lord used to beat me for my left-handedness.When I killed him, I used both hands. Out of respect.”
name: Twinned blow
text: If you Skirmish targeting a single character, you may give it [Tier] disadvantage. If you do, you may ‘Flurry’, Dealing [Body / 2] or [Talent / 2] damage to the same target afterwards. Flurrying counts as a Swift Skirmish at 0 cost. Other techniques cannot change Flurry's targeting.

flavor: “My lord used to beat me for my left-handedness.When I killed him, I used both hands. Out of respect.”
name: Frenzied Barrage
text: If you spend 2 or more Focus on a finisher, you may give it [Tier] Disadvantage. If you do, you may ‘Flurry’ twice, each of them targeting a character the Finisher targeted.

flavor: “My lord used to beat me for my left-handedness.When I killed him, I used both hands. Out of respect.”
name: Varied Blades
text:
Your Skirmishes have an additional two effects that alternate every time you Skirmish, resetting at the start of your Turn (first Skirmish uses effect A, second uses effect B, third uses effect A again). Choose two of the options below as effects:
‣ Astral: Gain [Tier / 2] Focus.
‣ Blazing: Deal [Tier / 2] damage to your target.
‣ Umbral: Teleport to a space within [Tier] spaces.
‣ Vorpal: Restore [Tier / 2] Health.
‣ Phasing: This attack ignores its target’s Armor.
‣ Whirling: Move your target [Tier] spaces.

flavor: “You choose, live on your knees or die on your feet.”
name: “Pathetic”
text: After you increase Tension on your Turn or KO Fodder you may “Impose”, Fearing enemies in a 3x3 Zone centered on yourself, and dealing [Tier] damage to them if they weren't already Feared.

flavor: “You choose, live on your knees or die on your feet.”
name: “Out Of My Way”
text: Before you move with Stride or Jump you may change the distance you’re moving to [Body]. If you do, you may choose any characters you would move into the space of, and move them 1 space each and Impose after you end your movement.

flavor: “You choose, live on your knees or die on your feet.”
name: “Fools And Dead Men”
text: After you Knock Out an enemy, gain 2 Focus and 1 AP, after you Knock Out a non-fodder NPC due to the damage dealt through Impose, place a Fodder Zone in their space.

flavor: “Mankind is a friend to the spear. We grew in wisdomand technique alongside our oldest defender. Know this,vile foe: this thrust carries the weight of all humanhistory behind it!”
name: Pierce
text: Your Skirmish and Body Finisher can target one enemy within 2 range instead of its normal targeting. Your Skirmishes gain Advantage equal to your target’s distance from you (up to a maximum of 3).

flavor: “Mankind is a friend to the spear. We grew in wisdomand technique alongside our oldest defender. Know this,vile foe: this thrust carries the weight of all humanhistory behind it!”
name: Phalanx
text: Your Skirmish and Body Finishers can target an enemy within 3 range instead of its normal targeting. Skirmish targets all enemies between yourself and your original target(s), dealing half damage to each.

flavor: “Mankind is a friend to the spear. We grew in wisdomand technique alongside our oldest defender. Know this,vile foe: this thrust carries the weight of all humanhistory behind it!”
name: Cannon-Arm [ Breathe → Skirmish ]
text: The Skirmish can target a space in 4 spaces and raises the maximum Advantage from “Pierce” to 4. If the attack had 4 or more total Advantage, it additionally targets all spaces adjacent to the original, dealing half its damage to said targets. Each affected space becomes Difficult Terrain.

flavor: “I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. Isee you. I see you. I’m hungry. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you.”
name: Yearn
text: The first time you Investigate each Turn, it becomes Swift, has its Cost Reduced to 0, and has a range of [Body]. However, it can only be used to ask what your target’s current and maximum Health is. When any opponent is Knocked Out while adjacent to you, you heal [Body] HP.

flavor: “I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. Isee you. I see you. I’m hungry. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you.”
name: Obsess
text: If you know an opponent has half their maximum Health remaining or less, your Speed is increased by 3, and you ignore Difficult Terrain, but you cannot move unless you’re moving closer to at least one of said opponents.

flavor: “I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you. Isee you. I see you. I’m hungry. I see you. I see you. I seeyou. I see you. I see you. I see you. I see you.”
name: Devour
text: Once per Scene, after you heal using “Yearn” you may ‘Indulge’, Immobilizing and Dazing yourself. While you’re under these Effects, the Focus gained through Breathe and Charge are replaced with healing a Wound.

flavor: “I will not let you destroy my world!”
name: Warrior Of Legend
text: Once per Scene, After you Charge or Awaken this with at least 2 Tension, you may ‘Transform’, pushing all enemies within 2 range 3 spaces away. While Transformed you are Strengthened and Reinforced at all times. If you’re reduced to 0 Health while Transformed, it ends, and you’re Dazed.

flavor: “I will not let you destroy my world!”
name: Hero’s Feat
text:
Your Transformation has an additional effect for its duration chosen from the list below.
‣ Feat Of Strength: All your push effects have their distance doubled, and characters you push adjacent to another character take [Tier] damage.
‣ Feat Of Speed: Before you take an Action move up to double its Cost in spaces, if this makes you leave adjacency with enemies deal [Tier] damage to them.
‣ Feat Of Sturdiness: Reinforced grants you 1 additional Armor. After you reduce incoming damage to 1 or less, deal [Tier] damage to the attacker.

flavor: “I will not let you destroy my world!”
name: Mastered Strength
text: .You may Daze yourself and spend 1 Focus to transform as soon as you deploy regardless of Tension.

flavor: “I’ve been looking my entire life, the way she carried me,we must have been at least 500 meters off the ground…Doesn't matter who she was, or where she was takingme, don’t think I’ll be able to sleep until I can ask her…”
name: Soar
text: After you Jump, you may Hasten yourself rather than moving. After you’re Hastened you enter ‘Flight Stance’, removing other Stances you had. While in Flight, incoming Attacks have [Tier] Disadvantage, and you ignore Terrain and enemies while moving. Attacking removes Flight Stance.

flavor: “I’ve been looking my entire life, the way she carried me,we must have been at least 500 meters off the ground…Doesn't matter who she was, or where she was takingme, don’t think I’ll be able to sleep until I can ask her…”
name: Hunt
text: After you Attack a Launched character in Flight (and don’t Spike), you may end your Turn to Disappear with them. When either of you reappear, the other appears in an adjacent space of their choice, and you deal [Speed/2] damage to all adjacent enemies.

flavor: “I’ve been looking my entire life, the way she carried me,we must have been at least 500 meters off the ground…Doesn't matter who she was, or where she was takingme, don’t think I’ll be able to sleep until I can ask her…”
name: Falling Ax Strike
text: The Attacks you use while in the Flight can roll [Speed] rather than an Attribute, doing so removes Hastened and Launches your target.

flavor: “A bloodied coin spends just as well as any other.”
name: Ambush
text: If the first Action you take after Deploying is Hide, it has no Cost and ignores its requirements.

flavor: “A bloodied coin spends just as well as any other.”
name: Assassinate
text: Attacks you make while Disappeared gain [Tier] Advantage, let you reappear adjacent to characters, and the dice rolled Crit on rolls of 5 or 6.

flavor: “A bloodied coin spends just as well as any other.”
name: Speed of Dark [ Hide → Stride ]
text: The Stride has no cost, turns you Invisible when used, and gives your next Finisher on that Turn [Speed / 2] Advantage.

flavor: “The unseen attack is the perfect assault.”
name: Long Shot
text: Your Talent Finisher can target characters within 5 range instead of its normal targeting.

flavor: “The unseen attack is the perfect assault.”
name: Bunker Down
text: If you end your turn without Attacking you may “Bunker Down”, gaining Immobilized. While you’re Immobilized, your Talent Finishers gain 5 additional range and Crit on rolls of 5 or 6.

flavor: “The unseen attack is the perfect assault.”
name: Deadeye [ Hide → Talent Finisher ]
text: The Finisher deals [Crits rolled] + [Distance from target] additional damage, and targets enemies between yourself and your original target (as per any shortest path).

flavor: “Obstacles are found everywhere. In overcoming them,we nourish ourselves.”
name: Flying Kick [ Jump → Skirmish ]
text: If the Skirmish is against one adjacent target, it gains Advantage equal to the number of spaces you moved during your Jump, up to a max of [Talent].

flavor: “Obstacles are found everywhere. In overcoming them,we nourish ourselves.”
name: Wall Jump
text: After you end a Jump’s movement adjacent to an Obstacle or board edge, you may move an additional 3 spaces in a straight line and gain 1 Evasion. This additional movement is considered part of the Jump’s total movement. You can only “Wall Jump” once per Turn.

flavor: “Obstacles are found everywhere. In overcoming them,we nourish ourselves.”
name: Weightless Body
text: You may “Wall Jump” any number of times in a Jump. You can't use the effect of “Wall Jump” on the same Obstacle or board edge more than once per Jump.

flavor: Stance“A weapon’s strength is secondary to the strength ofthose who wield it.”
name: Draw Stance
text: After you Breathe or Charge, you may enter ‘Draw Stance’, removing any other Stances you had. This effect ends after you Attack, Stride, or Jump. If you use a Talent Finisher or Skirmish in Draw Stance, you can Crit on rolls of 5 or 6.

flavor: Stance“A weapon’s strength is secondary to the strength ofthose who wield it.”
name: Divide In One Motion [ Breathe → Jump ]
text: The Jump does not end Draw Stance. After using the Jump, you may use a Talent Finisher at no AP Cost. The Finisher targets all enemies you moved into adjacency with or through during your Jump.

flavor: Stance“A weapon’s strength is secondary to the strength ofthose who wield it.”
name: Leaping Koi
text: If you use “Divide In One Motion”, roll the Finisher before using your Jump’s Movement. For every Critical Hit rolled in the Finisher, you may move an additional 3 spaces in a straight line. This additional movement is considered part of the Jump’s total movement.

flavor: “These scars and bindings are a reminder of what I was.And in keeping them, I remind myself of what I can be.”
name: Hook Shot
text: After you Cast targeting a non-adjacent unoccupied space, you may ‘Swing’. When you do, track your distance from the target, and Teleport to any space an equal distance away from the target.

flavor: “These scars and bindings are a reminder of what I was.And in keeping them, I remind myself of what I can be.”
name: Draw In
text: Before you Cast targeting an opponent, you may choose not to deal damage. If you do, the Cast has its Cost reduced to 0, move one space towards them, and pull them one space towards you, repeating until you both can’t move any more.

flavor: “These scars and bindings are a reminder of what I was.And in keeping them, I remind myself of what I can be.”
name: Momentum [ Cast → Skirmish ]
text: If movement provided by your Cast moved you adjacent to the target of your Skirmish, you gain [Tier x 2] Advantage on that Skirmish and you push them 4 spaces.

flavor: “Though it’s fallen slightly out of favor, thrown weaponshave been a part of our culture for hundreds of years,and it’s time people start respecting that.”
name: Throw
text: You now use ‘Weapons’ instead of Focus. You start all Scenes with 4 Weapons. Before you Skirmish, you can ‘Throw’, spending 1 Weapon, reducing its cost to 0, and letting it target one character within 4 range instead of its normal targeting.

flavor: “Though it’s fallen slightly out of favor, thrown weaponshave been a part of our culture for hundreds of years,and it’s time people start respecting that.”
name: Resupply
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. After you resolve a Skirmish with Throw, place a ‘Weapon Marker’ in the space you targeted or an unoccupied space adjacent to it. After you move into a Weapon Marker’s space, you may remove it to move 1 space and gain 1 Weapon.

flavor: “Though it’s fallen slightly out of favor, thrown weaponshave been a part of our culture for hundreds of years,and it’s time people start respecting that.”
name: Chaser
text: When an enemy leaves the space of a Weapon Marker, you may Teleport to the marker and Skirmish them as a Punish at no Focus cost, this Skirmish can't use Throw.

flavor: “The shop always brings back nostalgia, the smell of oiland tin, the sound of motors and dad’s music box. Ikeep asking where he got this stuff, or why guards stopby to talk with him, but I never get a straight answer.”
name: Adaptive Edge
text: Choose another Weapon Technique you have, it’s your ‘Primary Form’. Choose a Weapon Technique you don’t have, its first 2 Levels are your ‘Secondary Form’, if it has an alternate Foci, track it separately and use it as your Focus in that Form. Start combat in your Primary Form, after your first Breathe or Charge each Turn, swap your Form. After you swap, gain the Technique, triggering any start of Turn / Scene effects, and lose the one you left. You cannot unlock your Secondary Form’s Levels through Tier increases.

flavor: “The shop always brings back nostalgia, the smell of oiland tin, the sound of motors and dad’s music box. Ikeep asking where he got this stuff, or why guards stopby to talk with him, but I never get a straight answer.”
name: Protean
text: Upgrade your secondary form to level 3. You may charge at 1 Cost so long as you haven't swapped forms this Turn.

flavor: “The shop always brings back nostalgia, the smell of oiland tin, the sound of motors and dad’s music box. Ikeep asking where he got this stuff, or why guards stopby to talk with him, but I never get a straight answer.”
name: Syzygy
text:
Gain a benefit after you swap for the first time each Turn, based on the Archetype of that Form.
‣ Powerhouse: Strengthen and Reinforce yourself.
‣ Vagabond: Strengthen and Hasten yourself.
‣ Bulwark: Reinforce yourself and gain [Body] Evasion.
‣ Altruist: Strengthen allies within [Tier] spaces.
‣ Disruptor: Snare an enemy within [Tier] spaces.
‣ Ruiner: Gain [Spirit] Focus and Steady yourself.

flavor: The vibration of whirring chains, the sound of spinninggears, the buckling of mismatched plating and loosescrews, it almost feels like it’s alive.
name: Running Hot
text: You now use ‘Heat’ instead of Focus. You start all Scenes with 0 Heat, substitute all Focus costs with gaining Heat instead, effects that would give Focus reduce Heat instead. If your Heat increases to 6 or more it is reset to 3, and you explode, dealing [Mind] damage to yourself and all adjacent enemies.

flavor: The vibration of whirring chains, the sound of spinninggears, the buckling of mismatched plating and loosescrews, it almost feels like it’s alive.
name: Overload
text: Before you Skirmish or Finisher, you may “Overload”, gaining [Mind / 2] Advantage and Blighting the target(s), afterwards you receive 1 Heat for every Crit you rolled.

flavor: The vibration of whirring chains, the sound of spinninggears, the buckling of mismatched plating and loosescrews, it almost feels like it’s alive.
name: Overclock
text: After you Breathe with at least 2 Tension, you may ‘Overclock’ until the end of your next Turn. While Overclocked, dealing or taking any amount of damage generates 1 Heat. Whenever you would explode while Overclocked, you may instead set your Heat to 3 to take [Mind / 2] damage, move up to 3 spaces, and gain 1 AP.

flavor: Avoidance“A little something to take the edge of~” f
name: Down The Hatch
text: Establish what direction is “up” after Deploying. After you Breathe, you may ‘Drink’ Slowing yourself. Once per Turn, if you start or end your Turn while Slowed you must roll a d6, and move one space in a Line based on the result: 1: Up, 2: Right, 3: Down, 4: Left, 5/6: Any direction. When involuntary movement would move you adjacent to, out of adjacency with, or have your movement prevented by an enemy you may deal [Tier] damage to them, up to once per type of trigger per enemy per turn.

flavor: Avoidance“A little something to take the edge of~” f
name: Fool’s Dance
text: If you end your Turn while Slowed, gain Evasion equal to [Tier/2] + the number of Negative Effects on you.

flavor: Avoidance“A little something to take the edge of~” f
name: Chug
text: The first Breathe on your Turn is Swift. After you Drink while Slowed,​you Shred, Weaken, and Blight yourself. If you have 3 or more Negative Effects at once, you may ignore the effects of each. The movement from “Down The Hatch” can now trigger with any Negative Effect, and when triggered with two or more Effects it changes to “twice per Turn”.

flavor: “Topple the Goliath, find the minute weaknesses ineveryone you face, disassemble their idiot stances, fightdirty, and have a plan to kill everyone you meet.”
name: Study Weakness
text: After you Investigate a character, place a ‘Weak Point’ in a space adjacent to them that doesn't have one, and your Investigations that target the same character are Swift this Turn. Weak Points move to match their host’s movement. After you move into a Weak Point, you may remove it to ‘Jab’ dealing [Mind/2] damage to its host. This counts as a Skirmish but cannot have its damage or targeting altered.

flavor: “Topple the Goliath, find the minute weaknesses ineveryone you face, disassemble their idiot stances, fightdirty, and have a plan to kill everyone you meet.”
name: Dissect [ Investigate x 3 ]
text: The third Investigate has no Cost, and Slows all Marked Enemies.

flavor: “Topple the Goliath, find the minute weaknesses ineveryone you face, disassemble their idiot stances, fightdirty, and have a plan to kill everyone you meet.”
name: 4-Point Execution
text: Whenever you move, you may teleport to a space an equal number of spaces away, so long as the teleport targets a Weak Point. After you remove 3 Weak Points from one target in a single Turn, you may teleport to any space adjacent to them and perform a Mind Finisher at no cost.

flavor: “Float like a butterfy…” l
name: Sting
text: Once per Turn, if you’ve moved with Stride on the same Turn, you may ‘Jab’ an adjacent target at no Cost. A Jab deals [Talent/2] damage to its target and counts as a Swift Skirmish; features other than this Technique cannot change a Jab’s damage or targeting.

flavor: “Float like a butterfy…” l
name: Shifting Blows
text: You may move up to two spaces in a straight line after Skirmishing.

flavor: “Float like a butterfy…” l
name: Rebound
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. If movement provided by Skirmish moves you into adjacency with a character who hasn’t been attacked this Turn you may Jab them (as described in “Sting”).

flavor: “It was over before it even started. I don’t know who youpissed of, but they moved like nothing I’ve ever seen.” f
name: Fade
text: You can move through enemies. You still must end your movement in an empty space.

flavor: “It was over before it even started. I don’t know who youpissed of, but they moved like nothing I’ve ever seen.” f
name: Flash Step [ Breathe → Stride ]
text: The Stride lets you move triple its normal distance.

flavor: “It was over before it even started. I don’t know who youpissed of, but they moved like nothing I’ve ever seen.” f
name: Flash Strike
text: After you move out of a character’s space using “Fade”, you may deal [Talent / 2] damage to them (this is not an Attack). You can't use this on the same target more than once each Round. After you trigger this while using “Flash Step” you may Launch any characters you damage.

flavor: “And what's this! It looks like she can’t be hit! They’removing at speeds I can’t even keep up with! Champlooks like she’s boxing ghosts!”
name: Duck
text: The first time you Dodge each Round, gain [Talent / 2] additional Evasion.

flavor: “And what's this! It looks like she can’t be hit! They’removing at speeds I can’t even keep up with! Champlooks like she’s boxing ghosts!”
name: Weave
text: You can move one additional space when using Dodge. If your Evasion reduces damage to 0, you may move as if you Dodged.

flavor: “And what's this! It looks like she can’t be hit! They’removing at speeds I can’t even keep up with! Champlooks like she’s boxing ghosts!”
name: Fighter's Instinct [ Dodge → Skirmish ]
text: The Skirmish lets you move 3 spaces before targeting and lets you Crit on rolls of 5 or 6.

flavor: “Heavy Build. Tall. Reach advantage. Confident,capable. Trained in the four forms of Cavalcabo.Their salute will transfer into a sudden flèche. This hasserved them well against inexperienced opponents. Bindthe attack, then transfer to a quick glide. During theirshock, apply knee to groin. Begin gloating.”
name: Plan and Execute
text: Begin tracking ‘Cunning Plan’, a 4 Segment Clock that’s emptied after every Scene. After you Investigate a character you haven’t Investigated in the Turn, fill one Cunning Plan Segment. Once per Turn, you may empty a Segment to take any non-Attack Action, reducing its Cost by 1 and gaining Swift.

flavor: “Heavy Build. Tall. Reach advantage. Confident,capable. Trained in the four forms of Cavalcabo.Their salute will transfer into a sudden flèche. This hasserved them well against inexperienced opponents. Bindthe attack, then transfer to a quick glide. During theirshock, apply knee to groin. Begin gloating.”
name: Plans Within Plans
text: “Plan and Execute”s spending portion is no longer once per Turn.

flavor: “Heavy Build. Tall. Reach advantage. Confident,capable. Trained in the four forms of Cavalcabo.Their salute will transfer into a sudden flèche. This hasserved them well against inexperienced opponents. Bindthe attack, then transfer to a quick glide. During theirshock, apply knee to groin. Begin gloating.”
name: At a Glance
text: The first time you Investigate each Turn you may spend 1 Focus to Investigate another enemy within [Mind] spaces of the target.

flavor: “Only the most conceited, self-important, piece ofsho’vah grit could do what you do. No! That's not adamn compliment!”
name: Peak Condition
text:
Begin tracking ‘Style’, a 4 Segment Clock that’s emptied after every Scene. Whenever you Attack, fill one Style Segment for each of the following conditions that it fulfilled. After you take damage from an Attack, empty one. After you fill the Clock, empty it, move up to 2 spaces in a Line, and gain 1 AP.
‣ Drama: Attack rolled 2 or more Critical Hits.
‣ Dance: Previous action moved you Adjacent to target.
‣ Diversify: You didn’t use the Attack on your last Turn.
‣ Denouement: Attack brought you to 0 AP.

flavor: “Only the most conceited, self-important, piece ofsho’vah grit could do what you do. No! That's not adamn compliment!”
name: Dance With Me
text: The first time you move each Turn without spending AP, fill one Style Segment.

flavor: “Only the most conceited, self-important, piece ofsho’vah grit could do what you do. No! That's not adamn compliment!”
name: Finale
text: Your attacks that fill at least 2 Style Segments before dice are rolled Crit on a roll of 5 or 6. Once per Scene, when a single Attack fills 4 Style Segments, you may lose the movement and AP gained from “Peak Condition” to deal [Tension + Tier] Damage to the target of the attack instead.

flavor: “Impossible… she only saw that technique once!”
name: “Anything You Can Do…”
text: Once per Round, after you Dodge or Clash, you gain an ‘Impression’ with the same name as the attacker. As an Action with no Cost, you may spend any of your Impressions to use the indicated NPC’s Attack as if you were an NPC. All Impressions are lost at the end of a Scene.

flavor: “Impossible… she only saw that technique once!”
name: Rehearsed Movements
text: After you Dodge an NPC while you hold an Impression matching their name, you gain 2 additional Evasion.

flavor: “Impossible… she only saw that technique once!”
name: “…I Can Do Better”
text: After you gain an Impression you may spend 1 Focus to gain that NPCs Passive effect until you spend the Impression.

flavor: “You were really expecting a fair fght?” i
name: Pack Tactics
text: Once per Round, when an ally resolves an Attack on a character within [Talent] spaces, you may Swiftly Skirmish targeting them at no Cost. If you are outside Skirmish’s range, you may Teleport to a space adjacent to the target before drawing range.

flavor: “You were really expecting a fair fght?” i
name: Hungry Eyes
text: When an ally within [Talent] spaces targets a character with an attack, you may spend 1 Focus to Mark the target.

flavor: “You were really expecting a fair fght?” i
name: Launcher Combo
text: Once per Round, when an ally inflicts an Effect to an enemy within [Talent] spaces, you may use the effect “Pack Tactics” on the same target. This level has a separate once per Round limitation from the one in “Pack Tactics”.

flavor: “Strike me if you dare.”
name: Catch The Blade
text: At the beginning of your turn, you may name any number and note it down until the end of the Scene. If you take damage from an enemy equal to a number you’ve noted, gain [Mind] Evasion before the damage is dealt.

flavor: “Strike me if you dare.”
name: Watch And Wait
text: Whenever you take damage from an enemy, you may note another number with “Catch The Blade”. Enemies who attack you cannot roll additional dice with their Critical Hits.

flavor: “Strike me if you dare.”
name: To Carry Their Fury
text: After you reduce an attack’s damage to 0 with Evasion, you may teleport adjacent to the attacker and Swiftly Skirmish them at no cost. After you make an attack and deal damage equal to a number you noted, you may remove any of your noted numbers to deal two additional damage for each removed.

flavor: Effects“You thought that was the last one?”
name: Multi-Faceted
text:
Gain the three following ‘Armaments’ each one has a condition, and if you Skirmish while that condition is fulfilled you ‘Equip’ it, replacing any Armament you had Equipped before. Each Armament can only be Equipped once per Turn.
‣ Blade: Skirmish while exactly 2 spaces away from an enemy and adjacent to none. This Skirmish is Swift, before targeting, move one space. After resolving the Skirmish, Strengthen yourself.
‣ Pole: Skirmish 2 adjacent enemies. This Skirmish is Swift, and pushes your targets 3 spaces away from you. After resolving the Skirmish, Launch your targets.
‣ Chain: Skirmish while exactly 4 spaces from your intended Target. This Skirmish is Swift and targets one character 4 spaces away from you. After resolving the Skirmish, Shred your target .

flavor: Effects“You thought that was the last one?”
name: Like Water
text: The 2nd time you Equip an Armament each Turn, you gain 1 AP and Hasten yourself.

flavor: Effects“You thought that was the last one?”
name: Master At Work
text:
If you use a Talent Finisher while you have an Armament Equipped, you gain a bonus based on the Armament.
‣ Blade: Move two spaces ignoring characters, if you passed through the Finisher’s Target Mark and Launch your target.
‣ Pole: This Finisher targets a 2 space Line drawn from your space. If this Finisher Spikes a Launched character it gains an additional [Tier] Advantage and the spaces you targeted become Difficult Terrain.
‣ Chain: This Finisher targets all enemies in a 1x1 Zone centered on a space adjacent to you, for each Critical Hit you roll that Zone expands by 1 space in every direction (1x1 > 3x3 > 5x5…) and deals one additional damage.

flavor: “It’s said that to effectively counter an oncoming force,one would need 5 times the force to stop it. I assureyou… I have that.”
name: 30,000 Tons
text: Before you Skirmish you may ‘Brace’, targeting no characters, Reinforcing yourself, and Taunting all adjacent enemies. If you Skirmish while Reinforced you ‘Slam’, dealing [Tension] additional damage and losing Reinforced.

flavor: “It’s said that to effectively counter an oncoming force,one would need 5 times the force to stop it. I assureyou… I have that.”
name: Hammerfall
text: If you Slam after taking at least 5 damage before reductions since the end of your last Turn, you target all spaces adjacent to you instead of your normal targeting and Weaken all targets.

flavor: “It’s said that to effectively counter an oncoming force,one would need 5 times the force to stop it. I assureyou… I have that.”
name: “You Look Like A Nail”
text: If you Slam after taking at least 10 damage before reductions since the end of your last Turn you deal an additional [Body] damage.

flavor: “You’re an expert at making strangers hate you, huh?”
name: Easy To Hate
text: Gain 3 Focus at the start of each Scene. After you Investigate an enemy, you may spend 1 Focus to Taunt them.

flavor: “You’re an expert at making strangers hate you, huh?”
name: Bully
text: Once per Turn after you Taunt a character you may move up to 3 spaces towards them, if you move into adjacency with them, Snare them and gain 1 AP.

flavor: “You’re an expert at making strangers hate you, huh?”
name: Add Injury To Insult
text: Your Attacks against characters you’ve Taunted gain [Tier/2] Advantage.

flavor: One of the most fearsome gangs is Pantomime, theinfamous “Cavalry”, riding diesel guzzling steeds. Knownacross the city for their “Night rides”, driving free andencircling anyone who dares standing in their way.
name: Trusty Steed
text: After Deploying, you may Summon a Mount NPC with a Tier equal to yours adjacent to you.

flavor: One of the most fearsome gangs is Pantomime, theinfamous “Cavalry”, riding diesel guzzling steeds. Knownacross the city for their “Night rides”, driving free andencircling anyone who dares standing in their way.
name: Grasping Jaws
text: After your Mount attacks an enemy, you may have it Taunt them.

flavor: One of the most fearsome gangs is Pantomime, theinfamous “Cavalry”, riding diesel guzzling steeds. Knownacross the city for their “Night rides”, driving free andencircling anyone who dares standing in their way.
name: Roaring Entry
text: Once per Scene for 1 AP, you may have your Mount “Roar”. When it Roars, it Dazes enemies in 3 spaces of it, pushing them 2 spaces.

flavor: “Make way for Pantomime’s blazing star!”“The killer king with the inescapable pin!”“The one, the only… Raphaël Blasé!”
name: Restrain
text: After you Body Finisher, Snare your target, characters you have Snared also count as being Taunted by you.

flavor: “Make way for Pantomime’s blazing star!”“The killer king with the inescapable pin!”“The one, the only… Raphaël Blasé!”
name: Spine Breaker
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. If you would Spike a single Launched character, you may teleport to a space adjacent to your target and change the attack you are using into a Body Finisher at no Cost.

flavor: “Make way for Pantomime’s blazing star!”“The killer king with the inescapable pin!”“The one, the only… Raphaël Blasé!”
name: Finishing Move [ Body Finisher → Jump ]
text: Instead of moving with this Jump, you and a target of the Finisher Disappear. At the start of the next round or when either of you’re able to take another Action (whatever comes first) you both return to the board in the same spaces, Launching all other enemies in 2 range, and letting you Swiftly Body Finisher the initial target at no cost.

flavor: “No tricks, no frills, no bullshit.Just sit ups, squats, and plenty of juice”
name: For What The Spirit Lacks
text: You now use ‘Tenacity’ instead of Focus or AP, spending it in place of both. You start each Round of combat with 2 Tenacity + [Body / 2]. You can't gain Tenacity from anything other than this Technique. You can't use Cast or Spirit Finishers.

flavor: “No tricks, no frills, no bullshit.Just sit ups, squats, and plenty of juice”
name: Dig Deep, Stand Firm
text: After you’re targeted by an Attack, gain 1 Tenacity. When you would gain Focus, you reduce the cost of your first Finisher that Round by the same amount (this includes the initial AP cost as well as any additional cost added that would normally be paid with Focus).

flavor: “No tricks, no frills, no bullshit.Just sit ups, squats, and plenty of juice”
name: In The Face Of The Beyond
text: Once per Scene after you target an adjacent enemy you may spend 2 Tenacity to ‘Silence’ them. Silenced characters can only move or Attack on their turn, and their Attacks cannot apply or trigger any feature or effect other than damage. Enemies you Silence remain Silenced until they end their Turn outside of adjacency with you or until the end of the Round (whatever happens first).

flavor: Two swordsmen lock blades silhouetted by moonlight,the impact reverberating throughout the streets, blowingout a nearby streetlamp.One survivor lives on, regretting every second of it.
name: Perfect Deflection
text: After you perform a successful Clash, you gain 1 Focus and can move [Tier] spaces.

flavor: Two swordsmen lock blades silhouetted by moonlight,the impact reverberating throughout the streets, blowingout a nearby streetlamp.One survivor lives on, regretting every second of it.
name: “You’ll Have To Get Through Me!”
text: You may Clash with Attacks that target allies within [Spirit] spaces. Before you Clash, you may Teleport to a space adjacent to the character who initiated the attack.

flavor: Two swordsmen lock blades silhouetted by moonlight,the impact reverberating throughout the streets, blowingout a nearby streetlamp.One survivor lives on, regretting every second of it.
name: Drama And Spite
text: Gain 2 Advantage in Clashes. Your Spirit counts as being 2 higher while in Clashes

flavor: “Don’t worry, this happens to everyone your age.”
name: Beastly
text: Choose two non-Modifier NPC Types. Once per Scene, after you Charge or Awaken this with at least 2 Tension, you may ‘Transform’, pushing all enemies within 2 range 3 spaces away and restoring [Body x 2] Health. While Transformed you can use your NPCs' Attacks, said Attacks lose any additional damage from Tension. After you’re reduced to 0 Health while Transformed, it ends, and you’re Dazed.

flavor: “Don’t worry, this happens to everyone your age.”
name: Inheritance
text: Choose one of the two NPCs you chose when gaining “Beastly”. You gain that NPC’s Passive while Transformed, and use their on Deploy effects when you Transform. If the Passive triggers when the user is Knocked Out, it triggers after you end your Transformation instead.

flavor: “Don’t worry, this happens to everyone your age.”
name: Apex
text: While you’re Transformed you can use your NPCs’ Actions by spending 1 AP. If you’re Tier 3 or higher you may Daze yourself and spend 2 Focus to transform as soon as you deploy regardless of Tension.

flavor: Tybalt’s Faerie is a strange thing, stays hidden wheneverit can. Its ability to shield and mend is invaluable for aguard, but he worries something's wrong with it, withevery beast they fend off it stares at the body longer,and when tensions rise he swears he hears sobbing.
name: Two Bodies
text: You can Block when other characters are attacked, granting that character any Armor you would gain and preventing any forced movement they’d receive. When you would Block for an ally without a ‘Guardian’ marker, first create one in a space within [Spirit] range. Unless the Guardian is adjacent to the attacker or the target when you Block, the Block is canceled. If you move while you have a Guardian you may move them the same distance.

flavor: Tybalt’s Faerie is a strange thing, stays hidden wheneverit can. Its ability to shield and mend is invaluable for aguard, but he worries something's wrong with it, withevery beast they fend off it stares at the body longer,and when tensions rise he swears he hears sobbing.
name: Together In Life
text: Allies who start their turn adjacent to or in the Guardian’s space are Reinforced, enemies who do the same are Marked.

flavor: Tybalt’s Faerie is a strange thing, stays hidden wheneverit can. Its ability to shield and mend is invaluable for aguard, but he worries something's wrong with it, withevery beast they fend off it stares at the body longer,and when tensions rise he swears he hears sobbing.
name: Together In Death
text: Your Blocks for allies have their Focus cost reduced to 1 and scale off of your Spirit.

flavor: “Woah. You’re bigger in person. Like. Way bigger. Ohright, the armor, right away sir!”
name: Big Arms
text: Before you use a Body Finisher, you may spend 1 Focus to have it target each character in a 2x2 Zone adjacent to you.

flavor: “Woah. You’re bigger in person. Like. Way bigger. Ohright, the armor, right away sir!”
name: Immense
text: Gain [Body] additional maximum Health. You may take up a 2x2 section of spaces rather than one space when you Deploy, if you do so you can freely move through 1x1 enemies and Obstacles.

flavor: “Woah. You’re bigger in person. Like. Way bigger. Ohright, the armor, right away sir!”
name: Shockwave
text: Before you use a Body Finisher, you may spend 1 Focus to have it target all spaces adjacent to you, deal half damage, and have it Launch its targets.

flavor: Mushir Ahmed has a reputation for his displays ofconfidence. Most famously is his armor, it covers hislegs and arms but leaves his chest bare. It bafflesadvisors and opponents alike..
name: Tough As Stone
text: You can never have a Speed lower than 3 and can always move using your own Actions, ignoring all other rules to the contrary.

flavor: Mushir Ahmed has a reputation for his displays ofconfidence. Most famously is his armor, it covers hislegs and arms but leaves his chest bare. It bafflesadvisors and opponents alike..
name: Resilience
text: Gain [Body/2] Armor.

flavor: Mushir Ahmed has a reputation for his displays ofconfidence. Most famously is his armor, it covers hislegs and arms but leaves his chest bare. It bafflesadvisors and opponents alike..
name: Stainless Stride
text: At the beginning of your Turn, you may Immobilize yourself. While Immobilized, you can never take more damage than 4 + [Tier/2] in one instance (after all forms of damage reduction).

flavor: “If I get hurt, don’t stop running.”
name: White Knight
text: You may Block Attacks that target allies within [Body] spaces, when you do so you Teleport to a space adjacent to the ally being targeted and become the target instead.

flavor: “If I get hurt, don’t stop running.”
name: Steel Angel
text: The first Block you use each Round has no Focus cost and gives you [Tier] Armor after the Attack resolves until the start of your next Turn, if you’re Blocking for your allies.

flavor: “If I get hurt, don’t stop running.”
name: Inspire Courage
text: After you start movement by moving out of adjacency with an ally, they may move to a space adjacent to your new location and Reinforce.

flavor: His physique spoke to me.It said, “Get the fuck out of my way.”
name: Wild Charge
text: Before you Jump, you may move [Body] spaces instead of [Talent], deal 30 damage to Obstacles you move adjacent to, and move any number of characters you passed through or moved into adjacency with to a space adjacent to you.

flavor: His physique spoke to me.It said, “Get the fuck out of my way.”
name: Violence
text: Once per Round, after you move through characters using “Wild Charge”, you may deal [Body / 2] damage to them and Launch one of them.

flavor: His physique spoke to me.It said, “Get the fuck out of my way.”
name: “Eat Dirt!”
text: After you Launch an adjacent character without Attacking you may ‘Throw’ them, moving them 5 spaces in any direction. If they end their movement adjacent to another character or Obstacle deal [Body] damage to both and remove Launched from them.

flavor: “To truly love something, let it kill you~”
name: Lash
text: When an ally is hit by an Attack you may spend 1 Focus to Swiftly Cast targeting the attacker regardless of range at no AP Cost (this cannot trigger Lash or have you Cast targeting yourself).

flavor: “To truly love something, let it kill you~”
name: Loving Rite
text: When an ally is damaged you may take [Tier] damage to reduce the amount they took by [Tier]. After you trigger this because an ally was attacked, you may Fear the Attacker.

flavor: “To truly love something, let it kill you~”
name: Devotion
text: When an ally triggers “Loving Rite” you may Mark them, when you trigger “Lash” with an ally you’ve Marked, while there are no other allies you’ve Marked, you may use a Finisher instead of Cast. If you’re creating a character who can use Summons or NPC actions it’s important to familiarize yourself with the Narrator-side NPC rules on page 109.

flavor: They stood their ground. A breathing, bleeding wallbetween the people they had sworn to protect, and thecoming darkness.
name: Wall
text: Before you Block, you may spend 1 Focus to gain [Tier / 2] additional Armor, and retain the Armor until you take another reaction, or you start your Turn.

flavor: They stood their ground. A breathing, bleeding wallbetween the people they had sworn to protect, and thecoming darkness.
name: Shield Charge
text: After you Block, place a ‘Shield Marker’ in a space adjacent to you until you lose your Armor. The Shield Marker moves to match your movement. If your movement would move your Shield Marker into an opponent's space, you may remove the Marker to deal [Body / 2] damage to them and push them 2 spaces.

flavor: They stood their ground. A breathing, bleeding wallbetween the people they had sworn to protect, and thecoming darkness.
name: Focused Defense
text: While you have a Shield Marker, indicate a 3×3 Zone centered on it. If an attack would resolve against you while the attacker is inside that Zone, they're Weakened for the duration of the Attack.

flavor: “Nothing gets past me, at least not in one piece.”
name: Guardian
text: So long as you haven’t moved during your turn, the spaces diagonally connected to your count as being adjacent when it would benefit you.

flavor: “Nothing gets past me, at least not in one piece.”
name: On Watch
text: Begin tracking ‘Vigilance’, a 4 Segment Clock that’s filled at the start of every Scene. You may empty one Segment of this Clock when performing a Punish to have it not cost Focus. After you Charge, you refill the Vigilance Clock.

flavor: “Nothing gets past me, at least not in one piece.”
name: Zone Of Influence
text: After you Investigate you may place up to 4 ‘Spotlights’ in unoccupied spaces on the board. A Spotlight is a unique piece of Difficult Terrain that only affects enemies. When a character enters a Spotlight you may teleport to an adjacent space and Punish them as if they left adjacency with you.

flavor: “Runic alignment complete. Aether levels nominal. Wegot this partner. For Oberooooon!”
name: Rune Core Engine
text: You enter all combat Scenes with a ‘Suit’ adjacent to you. This is a 2x2 Obstacle with 15 Health and [Tier/2] Armor. By Interacting with it, you put the Suit on. This removes the Obstacle, grants you [Tier/2] Armor, and makes your character 2x2 in size. You may use Interact again to leave the Suit, losing these benefits and placing the Obstacle adjacent to you in sufficient empty spaces.

flavor: “Runic alignment complete. Aether levels nominal. Wegot this partner. For Oberooooon!”
name: Autonomous
text: The Suit is now a Summoned non- Modifier NPC of your choice with a Tier equal to yours, so long as you don’t have it on. It is still 2x2 in size and counts as an Obstacle while it’s not taking a Turn, (change its health to match the summon’s health, removing the 15 Obstacle health). While your Summon takes its Turn, you may Skirmish a character adjacent to it (regardless of range) in place of one of its Attacks.

flavor: “Runic alignment complete. Aether levels nominal. Wegot this partner. For Oberooooon!”
name: Perfect Sync
text: You may Interact with the Suit after Deployment at no Cost. Even while you are in the Suit, it may still take Turns as a Summon, sharing your space and moving you when it moves. While you are in the Suit, the Summon is Dazed.

flavor: “What’s my game? You seem confused, why play gameswith you when I’ve already won?”
name: Flash Of Insight
text: Once per Round, after any Roll from an enemy or willing ally, you may spend 1 Focus to force its initiator to redo it.

flavor: “What’s my game? You seem confused, why play gameswith you when I’ve already won?”
name: Take Advantage
text: When using “Flash Of Insight” against an enemy’s Attack the attack’s target gains [Mind/2] Evasion.

flavor: “What’s my game? You seem confused, why play gameswith you when I’ve already won?”
name: Watch And Wait
text: After you investigate an enemy, you may spend 2 additional Focus to ‘Predict’ them. The GM must tell you what actions they plan to use and the targets, if applicable. If that enemy does not take the action(s) described on their Turn they are immediately Dazed and Weakened.

flavor: “Keep your back straight!”“Strengthen your footing!”“Remember the plan!”“...”“That was good, keep at it, kid.”
name: Strike Order
text: After you mark a character, an ally of your choosing may move up to 3 spaces towards the character. Your Investigates are Swift.

flavor: “Keep your back straight!”“Strengthen your footing!”“Remember the plan!”“...”“That was good, keep at it, kid.”
name: Teaching Moment
text: When an ally is dealt a Wound you may Investigate the character who Wounded them at no Cost as a Reaction.

flavor: “Keep your back straight!”“Strengthen your footing!”“Remember the plan!”“...”“That was good, keep at it, kid.”
name: Remember Your Training
text: Once per Turn per ally, when an ally moves adjacent to an enemy through the movement given by “Strike Order”, you may have them deal their [Body/2] or [Talent/2] Damage to said enemy.

flavor: “Don’t worry buddy, everything’ll be okay!”
name: Calming Aura
text: Allies who start their turn adjacent to you may lose any one of their Effects and become Strengthened.

flavor: “Don’t worry buddy, everything’ll be okay!”
name: Protective Response
text: When an ally within [Talent] spaces takes a Wound or Effect from a source other than themselves you may Break Out at no Influence cost so long as it moves you adjacent to them.

flavor: “Don’t worry buddy, everything’ll be okay!”
name: “Are You Ok?”
text: Allies who start their turn next to you gain 3 Focus and restore [Tier] Health.

flavor: ”To blessed Hippocrates, I grant an offering. Let myhands remain steady and true. Let not guide this soul toThanatos’ waiting grip. This I swear. This is my Virtue.”
name: Do No Harm
text: If you Skirmish an ally, you may ‘Operate’ on them. When you Operate you must roll Mind instead of Talent or Body, and your target restores [Hits / 2] Health rather than taking Damage.

flavor: ”To blessed Hippocrates, I grant an offering. Let myhands remain steady and true. Let not guide this soul toThanatos’ waiting grip. This I swear. This is my Virtue.”
name: Operational Procedure
text: After you take this feature or after you take an Intermission, lose any ‘Bandages’ or ‘Disinfectant’, then roll [Mind / 2]. For every odd number rolled, gain one Bandage. For every even number rolled, gain one Disinfectant. After you Operate you may expend a Bandage to heal a Wound, and/or a Disinfectant to remove any number of Effects.

flavor: ”To blessed Hippocrates, I grant an offering. Let myhands remain steady and true. Let not guide this soul toThanatos’ waiting grip. This I swear. This is my Virtue.”
name: Miracle Worker
text: Gain 3 Advantage on your “Do No Harm” Roll. If you roll two or more 1s or two or more 6s with “Operational Procedure” you may replace the resources gained by those dice with a ‘Miracle’. When an ally is Knocked Out, place a marker where they were. After you Skirmish targeting this Marker; you may expend a Miracle to bring the Knocked Out character back to that space or an adjacent one if it’s occupied with full Health and 2 Wounds.

flavor: “Your ideas of combat are so limited, here, let me paintyou a picture of how far this canvas reaches.”
name: Stop And Think
text: Anytime you are Weakened you enter the ‘Tactician Stance’, removing any other Stances you had. While in the Tactician Stance, when your non-Attack Actions and Effects you apply deal damage gain 1 Focus, up to [Mind] times per turn.

flavor: “Your ideas of combat are so limited, here, let me paintyou a picture of how far this canvas reaches.”
name: Study
text: After you Breathe, you may Weaken yourself to gain 2 additional Focus.

flavor: “Your ideas of combat are so limited, here, let me paintyou a picture of how far this canvas reaches.”
name: Eureka!
text: After you start your turn in Tactician Stance, you gain 1 additional AP, and your first attack on this turn costs 1 more AP.

flavor: “Eye of newt and toe of frog, Wool of bat and tongue ofdog, Adder’s fork and blind-worm’s sting, Lizard’s legand owlet’s wing, For a charm of powerful trouble, Like ahell-broth boil and bubble.”
name: Quick Mix
text: After you Breathe, you can make one of the following ‘Potions’. You can Interact to use one of these Potions on yourself or a character within 4 range. 1: Pure Water: Remove any Effect(s) from the target. 2: Fury Vapors: Strengthen the target. 3: Growth Serum: Begin Regenerating the target. 4: Adrenaline Stim: Hasten the target. 5: Stoneskin Balm: Reinforce the target. 6: Vilethorn Poison: Blight the target.

flavor: “Eye of newt and toe of frog, Wool of bat and tongue ofdog, Adder’s fork and blind-worm’s sting, Lizard’s legand owlet’s wing, For a charm of powerful trouble, Like ahell-broth boil and bubble.”
name: Powerful Mix
text: The first Interact you use on your Turn has its Cost reduced to 0. After you use a potion on an ally they gain [Mind / 2] Focus. After you use a potion on an enemy you may deal [Mind] damage to them.

flavor: “Eye of newt and toe of frog, Wool of bat and tongue ofdog, Adder’s fork and blind-worm’s sting, Lizard’s legand owlet’s wing, For a charm of powerful trouble, Like ahell-broth boil and bubble.”
name: High Intensity Mix
text: If you Breathe you may replace its effect with triggering “Quick Mix” two more times, randomly determining the potions with a D6 roll for each rather than choosing.

flavor: The intimacy of combat is something that’s difficult torecreate. That intoxicating passion has drawn morepeople together than you can possibly know.
name: Dance Partner
text: You can Interact with a willing character to set them as your ‘Partner’. You may only have one Partner and lose them if you end your Turn outside of adjacency. When one partner moves willingly, the other may move to a space adjacent to them and gain Haste.

flavor: The intimacy of combat is something that’s difficult torecreate. That intoxicating passion has drawn morepeople together than you can possibly know.
name: Hearts In Tandem
text: The first time a Partner Hides, or gains Focus each Turn, their partner gains any positive Effects or Focus they gained.

flavor: The intimacy of combat is something that’s difficult torecreate. That intoxicating passion has drawn morepeople together than you can possibly know.
name: The Prestige
text: When a Partner uses a Finisher, their Partner may Daze themselves to have the finisher crit on rolls of 5 or 6, Teleport adjacent to the target, and use a Skirmish / Cast on the target. Using this effect makes the user lose their Partner status.

flavor: An infinite barrage of bullets and blades. A force thatresembles an army but was born from a single hunterwith a mage at their side.
name: Echo Form
text: If you Cast targeting only an ally or yourself, you don’t deal damage or negative Effects. Instead, create an ‘Echo’ adjacent to them. Echos are targetable pieces of Difficult Terrain with 1 Health. A character with an Echo may draw range from their Echos. You can only make 1 + [Tier] Echos at a time.

flavor: An infinite barrage of bullets and blades. A force thatresembles an army but was born from a single hunterwith a mage at their side.
name: Symmetry
text: When a character with an Echo moves, they may move their Echo an equal number of spaces.

flavor: An infinite barrage of bullets and blades. A force thatresembles an army but was born from a single hunterwith a mage at their side.
name: Full Sync
text: Characters with an Echo start the Round with 1 additional AP per Echo they have. Characters benefiting from this give Swift to their Attacks, so long as each draws its range from a different Echo.

flavor: “A battle won unharmed is a fawless battle.” l
name: Barrier
text: If you Cast targeting one or more allies, you don't deal damage or Negative Effects, Reinforce them, and create a ‘Barrier’ between one of them and a space adjacent. Barriers are 5 + [Tier x 5] HP walls that move to match allies they were created for, and do not affect the targeting or movement of allies. After you create a Barrier it replaces all other Barriers.

flavor: “A battle won unharmed is a fawless battle.” l
name: Impenetrable
text: After you create a Barrier, extend it one space in both directions and give [Spirit / 2] Evasion to all allies adjacent to it.

flavor: “A battle won unharmed is a fawless battle.” l
name: Block Beam
text: After your Barrier would be removed or replaced for any reason it ‘Fires’ away from the character it was created for, dealing [Spirit] damage to all enemies in an infinitely long orthogonal Line.

flavor: The Ishtar Battalion has been described as“Avant-garde.” Both meanings are equally accurate.
name: Stroke Of The Brush
text:
You can Interact to ‘Paint’ on an adjacent space in a ‘Color’ of your choice. Each Color has a specific effect that triggers after you or an ally enters its space or starts their Turn in it for the first time in a Round. The Colors are as follows.
‣ Red: Strengthen yourself.
‣ Yellow: Teleport to another Colored space.
‣ Blue: Gain 2 Focus.
‣ White: Push any enemies in 3 spaces 3 spaces.
‣ Black: Pull any enemies in 5 spaces adjacent to you.

flavor: The Ishtar Battalion has been described as“Avant-garde.” Both meanings are equally accurate.
name: Canvas Of Flesh
text: The first Interact you use on your turn has its Cost reduced to 0. After you Interact with an ally, you may spend 3 Focus to create a ‘Seal’ on them, letting them gain the effect of one of your Colors every time they end their Turn.

flavor: The Ishtar Battalion has been described as“Avant-garde.” Both meanings are equally accurate.
name: Brush-Brand
text: After you Skirmish a character, you may ‘Brand’ them with a Color of your choice. After you or an ally Attack a Branded character, consume the Brand and the attacker triggers the effect of the Color.

flavor: “My father’s deck has no pathetic cards!”
name: Draw
text: After deploying, roll a die and set it aside. These dice are your ‘Cards’. After you Breathe with three or fewer Cards, roll a new Card. Before you Cast you may spend any of your Cards to roll [Mind] instead of [Spirit], have it deal no damage to allies, and gain the Card’s bonus. The bonuses for each are as follows: 1: Illness: Blights and permanently Slows the Target. 2: Etteilla: Restore Focus equal to the damage dealt. 3: Night: The target Disappears and becomes Invisible. 4: Protection: Permanently Reinforces the target. 5: Union: Teleport adjacent to, and Snare the target. 6: Folly: Dazes, Immobilizes, and Launches the target.

flavor: “My father’s deck has no pathetic cards!”
name: Card Capture
text: Once per Scene after you Investigate an NPC’s Attack, you can roll a Card with all of that attack’s non-damage effects. At the end of the scene you can replace a Card in your deck with that Card. You can only replace up to 3 of your Cards like this at a time, and can return your default Cards at any time.

flavor: “My father’s deck has no pathetic cards!”
name: Greed
text: “Draw” has you roll double the Cards in all scenarios, and you may gain Cards by Breathing when at or below 5 cards instead of 3.

flavor: “Cooking is like painting or writing a song. Just as thereare only so many notes or colors, there are only so manyfavors—it’s how you combine them that sets you apart.”l
name: Healthy Meal
text: You have [Mind / 2] ‘Meals’ that refresh each Intermission, you may Interact to hand an adjacent ally a Meal and Reinforce or Hasten them. When this Effect expires the character finishes their meal, and restores 4 + [Mind] Health.

flavor: “Cooking is like painting or writing a song. Just as thereare only so many notes or colors, there are only so manyfavors—it’s how you combine them that sets you apart.”l
name: Fast Food
text: After you move out of adjacency with an ally you may give them a Meal without Interacting.

flavor: “Cooking is like painting or writing a song. Just as thereare only so many notes or colors, there are only so manyfavors—it’s how you combine them that sets you apart.”l
name: Shared Experiences
text: When someone you’re Bonded with eats one of your Meals you both gain [Mind] Focus.

flavor: “When allies falter, your presence is the whisperedpromise of safety.”
name: Strength Of Prayer
text: You now use ‘Compassion’ instead of Focus. You start all Scenes with [Spirit] Compassion. You can't gain Compassion using Breathe or Charge, you gain 1 Compassion after you target an ally with an action or the effect of a Technique.

flavor: “When allies falter, your presence is the whisperedpromise of safety.”
name: Cleansing Light
text: If you Cast targeting an ally, you don't deal damage or Negative Effects, heal [Hits] Health to your target(s), and have all Effects of their choice removed from them.

flavor: “When allies falter, your presence is the whisperedpromise of safety.”
name: Grand Restoration
text: Your Spirit Finisher gains the effects of “Cleansing Light”, and can target characters within 5 range. When using a Spirit Finisher on an ally, they begin Regenerating and lose a Wound (Wounds can only be healed once per character per Scene).

flavor: Every surface is covered in small, intricately detailedpapers. This sort of obsessive protection seemed silly toher, but when removing one of these seals resulted invoices echoing around the room, she reconsidered.
name: Sacred Seal
text: If you Breathe, you may replace its effect with placing a ‘Talisman’ on an adjacent target. Spaces and characters with Talismans are always valid targets for your Casts, and after you Cast targeting them, you gain 1 Focus.

flavor: Every surface is covered in small, intricately detailedpapers. This sort of obsessive protection seemed silly toher, but when removing one of these seals resulted invoices echoing around the room, she reconsidered.
name: Tossed Talisman
text: When using “Sacred Seal” you may place Talismans on targets within 5 spaces, after you Charge or Awaken this, you may activate “Sacred Seal” and repeat the effect once for each Focus you would have gained.

flavor: Every surface is covered in small, intricately detailedpapers. This sort of obsessive protection seemed silly toher, but when removing one of these seals resulted invoices echoing around the room, she reconsidered.
name: Exorcize
text: Your Spirit Finisher can target all characters and spaces with Talismans at once. Doing this destroys your Talismans and gives you 2 Focus for each.

flavor: When the fog rolls off the river Undine, the city streetsare empty. For the darkened hunts would find those whodo not flee, meeting those who carry a smile as easily asa blade.
name: Blowing Smoke
text: After you Breathe on your Turn, you may replace its effect with creating ‘Fog’ in a space adjacent to you. At the end of your Turn, move your Fog up to 2 spaces in any direction. If you or an ally starts their Turn in Fog, they may Disappear. When a character Disappeared through this level reappears, they must do so in Fog, or as close as possible.

flavor: When the fog rolls off the river Undine, the city streetsare empty. For the darkened hunts would find those whodo not flee, meeting those who carry a smile as easily asa blade.
name: Mystic Mist
text: When a character reappears in Fog, they gain [Mind] Evasion and move up to 3 spaces.

flavor: When the fog rolls off the river Undine, the city streetsare empty. For the darkened hunts would find those whodo not flee, meeting those who carry a smile as easily asa blade.
name: Stinging Steam
text: Your Breaths are Swift. If you Stride you may replace its effect with moving your Fog Clouds up to 2 spaces and deal 2 damage to enemies every time a Fog Cloud passes through them.

flavor: He felt stupid. There it was, his face plastered on thegray brick in front of him. A blurry picture of it, but hisface nonetheless. ​These posters must have been put up by someone he’shelped, claiming he was some mythic savior. Areputation that would only make his life harder.​What annoyed him most, though, was a certainsomeone now knew he wasn't going to stop.
name: Notably Absent
text:
You may Assist at the start of any combat Scene regardless of your character’s condition. If you Break Out while Assisting allies, you may give them an Effect based on the Action taken, the actions and effects are as follows:
‣ Stride: Hasten.
‣ Breathe: Reinforce.
‣ Investigate: Strengthened.

flavor: He felt stupid. There it was, his face plastered on thegray brick in front of him. A blurry picture of it, but hisface nonetheless. ​These posters must have been put up by someone he’shelped, claiming he was some mythic savior. Areputation that would only make his life harder.​What annoyed him most, though, was a certainsomeone now knew he wasn't going to stop.
name: Heroic Return
text: At the start or end of any Turn where the Tension is 4 or higher you may return to the board from your Assisting on any border space. After you return to the board, you gain all Positive Effects your allies have. These Effects can't be removed until combat ends.

flavor: He felt stupid. There it was, his face plastered on thegray brick in front of him.
