A blurry picture of it, but hisface nonetheless. ​These posters must have been put up by someone he’shelped, claiming he was some mythic savior. Areputation that would only make his life harder.​What annoyed him most, though, was a certainsomeone now knew he wasn't going to stop.
name: Explosive Return
text: As soon as you return to the board, you may take a Turn, even if it would interrupt the turn of an enemy. If this interrupted an ally’s Turn you must wait for them to finish.

name: Accelerate
text: If you Cast targeting an ally, you don't deal damage or Negative Effects, they may move spaces equal to the damage you would have dealt, and then Hasten them.

name: Decelerate
text: Your Casts gain 1 Advantage. After you or an ally lose an Effect you may spend 1 Focus to apply the same effect again.

name: Time Stop
text: Begin tracking ‘Flux’, a 8 Segment Clock that’s emptied after every Scene. After you apply an Effect to an ally, fill one Flux Segment. Once per Scene, after you start your Turn with a full Flux Clock you may spend all your AP to empty it and Cast targeting all characters in the Scene. If there are two or fewer enemies you may take a Wound to go All Out and turn your roll against them into a Finisher.

flavor: “Doesn’t it all seem to have a rhythm to it? When thebullets are flying and everyone else is in chaos, thatrhythm guides me.”
name: Musician
text:
After you Breathe, gain a ‘Verse’ of your choice from the list below. You can hold up to 4 Verses at a time (Including repeated verses). After you use Charge, you may expend all the Verses you are holding and grant the effects listed on them to characters in a 3x3 Zone placed adjacent to you.
‣ Harsh: Allies Strengthen and may move 1 space.
‣ Soothing: Allies gain [Mind / 2] Health.
‣ Inspiring: Hasten and give 1 Focus to allies.
‣ Raucous: Shred, and deal 1 damage to enemies.
‣ Frantic: Allies may use a 1 Cost Utility action for free.

flavor: “Doesn’t it all seem to have a rhythm to it? When thebullets are flying and everyone else is in chaos, thatrhythm guides me.”
name: Reverb
text: Your Breaths are Swift. After you gain a Verse you may immediately perform its effect on adjacent characters without spending it.​

flavor: “Doesn’t it all seem to have a rhythm to it? When thebullets are flying and everyone else is in chaos, thatrhythm guides me.”
name: Encore
text: If you Charge with 3 or more Verses, you may forgo the Focus given to reduce its cost to 1.

flavor: A heretical idea to most, artificial Faeries able to be usedby the non-keeper guards employed by Eberon. Despitethe disapproval of most, more and more “royal keepers”have been appearing as of late.
name: Spirit Weaving Flame
text:
After you Charge for the first time in a scene you may create a “Spirit Flame” within 1 space of you, a marker that you can move up to 4 spaces after you Stride or end your Turn, it is pushed one space when its space is targeted with an attack. When a character is standing on or adjacent to your Spirit Flame they count as having an effect. Choose an option from the list below to determine the effect:
‣ Dreamy Spirit: Enemies are Slowed.
‣ Angry Spirit: Enemies are Blighted.
‣ Insightful Spirit: Enemies are Marked.
‣ Intense Spirit: Allies are Hasted.
‣ Kind Spirit: Allies are Regenerating.
‣ Violent Spirit: Allies are Strengthened.

flavor: A heretical idea to most, artificial Faeries able to be usedby the non-keeper guards employed by Eberon. Despitethe disapproval of most, more and more “royal keepers”have been appearing as of late.
name: Friendly Spirits
text: When an ally moves out of your Spirit Flame you may have it move to a space adjacent to their new position. When an enemy attempts to move out of your Spirit Flame you may spend 1 Focus to stop their movement after they move out of that space, leaving them adjacent to the Spirit Flame.

flavor: A heretical idea to most, artificial Faeries able to be usedby the non-keeper guards employed by Eberon. Despitethe disapproval of most, more and more “royal keepers”have been appearing as of late.
name: Twinned Spirits
text: You may choose an additional option from “Spirit Weaving Flame”, and if you create a Spirit Flame you may create two, one of each type, or create one with the properties of both.

flavor: “I don’t kill people, doctor. What I do is much worse.”
name: Bleeding Edge
text: Your successful Skirmishes and Talent Finishers Blight the target(s).

flavor: “I don’t kill people, doctor. What I do is much worse.”
name: Bloodhound
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. When a non-adjacent enemy takes damage from Blight, move up to 3 spaces. If it brings you adjacent, you may remove the Blight to Swift Skirmish them at no cost.

flavor: “I don’t kill people, doctor. What I do is much worse.”
name: Rupture [ Skirmish → Breathe ]
text: If the Skirmish targeted a character with Blight, roll Talent and trigger the effect of Blight [Hits] times.

flavor: “Now there’s a smell you can feel!”
name: Sublimation
text: Your Improvises have their Cost set to 1 and can create an Obstacle up to 4 spaces away. When resolving an action targeting an Obstacle, you may destroy it to create a 3×3 Zone of ‘Gas’ centered on its space that disappears at the start of your next Turn. When an enemy enters Gas they are Weakened. Allies in the Gas gain 3 Evasion when they’re targeted by attacks coming from outside the Gas.

flavor: “Now there’s a smell you can feel!”
name: Experimental Mixture
text: After you Weaken a character you may ask the Narrator what it’s current Health is, if it’s at or below [Mind] that character is Knocked Out and you gain 2 Focus.

flavor: “Now there’s a smell you can feel!”
name: Deposition
text: After you create a Gas Zone, deal [Mind] damage to all enemies in the spaces it covers. After you Knock Out an enemy with “Experimental Mixture”, create a 3x3 Gas Zone centered on them.

flavor: “Whips, garrotes, nooses, you’d be surprised how manypeople are killed with glorifed string.” i
name: Wrap
text: Your Successful Skirmishes with 1 target Snare the target. At the end of your Turn, you can move all characters you've Snared up to 5 spaces. You do not need to pull characters you’ve Snared after you move.

flavor: “Whips, garrotes, nooses, you’d be surprised how manypeople are killed with glorifed string.” i
name: Choke
text: Your Body and Talent finishers can always target characters you've snared. Your Finishers deal [Tier] additional damage to Snared characters.

flavor: “Whips, garrotes, nooses, you’d be surprised how manypeople are killed with glorifed string.” i
name: Twisting Impact
text: Your Skirmishes gain 1 Advantage. When “Wrap” moves a character into adjacency with other characters, they each receive [Talent/2] damage.

flavor: “It’s an easy job, in-and-out, no need for worries, noneed for anyone to get hurt. Bump into Āl-Amir just aftersunset and slip your hand into his pouch. Be sure toapologize and ofer something, historically he’ll refuse.” f
name: Fast Hands
text:
After you leave adjacency with an enemy on your Turn (once per character per Turn), you may end your movement, to do one of the following that you haven’t used on this Turn.
‣ Disarm: Weaken them.
‣ Trip: Slow them.
‣ Steal: Gain 2 Focus.

flavor: “It’s an easy job, in-and-out, no need for worries, noneed for anyone to get hurt. Bump into Āl-Amir just aftersunset and slip your hand into his pouch. Be sure toapologize and ofer something, historically he’ll refuse.” f
name: Snatch
text:
After you inflict certain Negative Effects on an enemy, you may gain its positive version. The Effects this applies to are as follows.
‣ Blight: Regenerate.
‣ Slow / Snare: Hasten.
‣ Shred: Reinforce.
‣ Weaken: Strengthen.

flavor: “It’s an easy job, in-and-out, no need for worries, noneed for anyone to get hurt. Bump into Āl-Amir just aftersunset and slip your hand into his pouch. Be sure toapologize and ofer something, historically he’ll refuse.” f
name: Rob Them Blind
text: If you used Hide on your Turn, you can use “Fast Hands” without ending your movement. Once per Scene, if you leave all spaces adjacent to the same character you may Blight, Slow, Shed, Weaken, and deal [Tension] damage to them.

flavor: “For hundreds of years the idea of Keeping a ‘light’ or‘solar’ Fairy was seen as a fruitless endeavor. Not onlywas it not fully known if they exist, all theories that spokeof them came to the conclusion that a Faerie of itsnature would far surpass the influence of any other kind.It’s no wonder its first known keeper has performed sowell among his peers.”
name: Blendendes Licht
text: Your Casts and Spirit Finishers that Crit weaken one of their targets for each Crit rolled.

flavor: “For hundreds of years the idea of Keeping a ‘light’ or‘solar’ Fairy was seen as a fruitless endeavor. Not onlywas it not fully known if they exist, all theories that spokeof them came to the conclusion that a Faerie of itsnature would far surpass the influence of any other kind.It’s no wonder its first known keeper has performed sowell among his peers.”
name: Sonneneruption
text: Your Spirit Finishers target a 2x3 Zone centered on you, without targeting you (I.e. in the shape of a “C” around you), and Crit on rolls of 5 or 6 if at least one of the targets has a Negative Effect.

flavor: “For hundreds of years the idea of Keeping a ‘light’ or‘solar’ Fairy was seen as a fruitless endeavor. Not onlywas it not fully known if they exist, all theories that spokeof them came to the conclusion that a Faerie of itsnature would far surpass the influence of any other kind.It’s no wonder its first known keeper has performed sowell among his peers.”
name: Falscher Stern
text: Once per Scene after you charge with at least 2 Tension you may replace its effect with drawing a full 4 Segment ‘Solar’ Clock, and placing a ‘Falscher Stern’ marker within 4 range. At the end of your Turn, if you have a Solar Clock, empty one segment and Swiftly Cast at no Cost, targeting all enemies in a 3x3 Zone centered on the Falscher Stern, if it was the last segment use a Spirit Finisher instead, removing the marker and the Clock.

flavor: “The Students of Mardrus were widely renowned in theirday, creating the doctoring profession as we know it.Shame their achievements are overshadowed by thehuman cost of their work.”
name: Transfusion
text: You no longer use Focus. Any increases to your max Focus increase your max Health instead. If you would spend, or lose Focus, use 2 Health per Focus instead, if you would gain Focus gain an equal amount of Health instead, any of this healing that would be prevented reduces the Focus cost of your next Finisher by the same amount. After you Attack a character with two or more different Effects, begin Regenerating.

flavor: “The Students of Mardrus were widely renowned in theirday, creating the doctoring profession as we know it.Shame their achievements are overshadowed by thehuman cost of their work.”
name: Overexert
text: After you Attack, you may take 5 damage to roll a D6. Apply an Effect to your target based on the result of the roll. If you have 5 or less Health, you may use this without taking damage. 1-2: Blight 3-4: Daze. 5-6: Immobilize.

flavor: “The Students of Mardrus were widely renowned in theirday, creating the doctoring profession as we know it.Shame their achievements are overshadowed by thehuman cost of their work.”
name: Born Of Mutable Flesh
text: Once per Scene, after you use a Spirit / Body Finisher you may trigger “Overexert” twice and change the Finisher’s targeting to all enemies with more Health than you.

flavor: “You lost the moment you touched the ground.”
name: Tectonic Shift
text: After you move an Obstacle you didn’t create or another character, you create an Obstacle with 10 Health and 0 Armor in the space it left.

flavor: “You lost the moment you touched the ground.”
name: Earthen Shards
text: After you destroy or move an Obstacle, you may deal [Tier] damage to all enemies adjacent to its new position. Each enemy can only be damaged by this effect once per Turn.

flavor: “You lost the moment you touched the ground.”
name: Stone Soldiers
text: After you Cast or use a Spirit Finisher, you may move an Obstacle adjacent to you into a space adjacent to your target. Doing so gives the Attack 3 Advantage and destroys the Obstacle after the Attack resolves.

flavor: “Lure and tempt, free them all of their inhibitions, showthem that the world holds better things for you andthem, before you rip it all away.”
name: “You wouldn’t hurt ME, would you?”
text: Gain 3 Focus at the start of each Scene. After you Investigate an enemy, you may spend 1 Focus to Fear them.

flavor: “Lure and tempt, free them all of their inhibitions, showthem that the world holds better things for you andthem, before you rip it all away.”
name: Irresistible
text: Once per turn after you Fear a character you may force them to move up to 3 spaces towards you, if they move into adjacency with you, you may Daze them and gain 1 Focus.

flavor: “Lure and tempt, free them all of their inhibitions, showthem that the world holds better things for you andthem, before you rip it all away.”
name: “A little help over here?”
text: After you Spirit or Mind Finisher a character, you may have all enemies affected by Fear move their Speed towards your target and deal [Tier] damage to them if they’re adjacent.

flavor: Yvon was never known for much, didn’t make a fuss,didn’t make enemies, and didn't make a name forhimself. But there were places where his name waswhispered in reverence. Old knights told tales of the boymost free, never chained down, no kings, no clients, nomasters. Never lingering, he appeared silently andpassed through crowds like flowing water. Thoughsometimes this reputation bothered him, he felt his lifecould do with a little more attachment.
name: Gentle Waves
text:
Your Casts that target one empty space are always Swift, and the first Cast you use on your Turn that fits this condition has no Cost. After you target an empty space with a Cast or Spirit Finisher, you may place a ‘Wave Seal’ in that space, up to a maximum of 4 + your Tier Wave Seals placed at a time. When a character (allies must be willing) start their turn in or move into a space with a Wave Seal, you may remove it to do one of the following:
‣ Move them up to 2 spaces in a Line.
‣ Launch them.

flavor: Yvon was never known for much, didn’t make a fuss,didn’t make enemies, and didn't make a name forhimself. But there were places where his name waswhispered in reverence. Old knights told tales of the boymost free, never chained down, no kings, no clients, nomasters. Never lingering, he appeared silently andpassed through crowds like flowing water. Thoughsometimes this reputation bothered him, he felt his lifecould do with a little more attachment.
name: Momentous Waves
text: After you move yourself or an ally with the effect of a Technique, the character who was moved deals 1 additional damage on their next Attack on their Turn, up to a max of [Spirit].

flavor: Yvon was never known for much, didn’t make a fuss,didn’t make enemies, and didn't make a name forhimself. But there were places where his name waswhispered in reverence. Old knights told tales of the boymost free, never chained down, no kings, no clients, nomasters. Never lingering, he appeared silently andpassed through crowds like flowing water. Thoughsometimes this reputation bothered him, he felt his lifecould do with a little more attachment.
name: Aqua Cage
text: If an enemy has a Wave Seal in each of their adjacent spaces, you may remove those Seals to Launch, Daze, and Immobilize them. Each enemy can only be affected by this once per Scene.

flavor: “True freedom doesn’t exist in this world. Even the windcannot blow on forever.”
name: Growing Winds
text: After you Cast targeting an unoccupied space or Jump, you may place a ‘Typhoon’ in the targeted space / space you left, and all spaces adjacent to it, replacing all other Typhoons you’ve created. When a character ends their Turn in a Typhoon you may move all characters in the Typhoon 1 space in the same direction.

flavor: “True freedom doesn’t exist in this world. Even the windcannot blow on forever.”
name: Updraft
text: After you end your Turn you may move any Typhoons 3 spaces in a Line. Any characters who enter the Typhoon through this movement are pushed 1 space in the direction it is moving and are Launched if they are an enemy.

flavor: “True freedom doesn’t exist in this world. Even the windcannot blow on forever.”
name: Mountain Carver
text: “Growing Winds” and “Updraft” can now move Obstacles as well as characters. If you move an Obstacle outside of a Typhoon you may have it continue its movement until it moves adjacent to a character, dealing [Tier] damage to that character. If an Obstacle is moved to the edge of the board through this feature, it is destroyed.

flavor: “Just… one… more… step…”
name: Steel Jaws
text: Your Skirmishes that target only empty spaces are always Swift. After you target only an empty space with a Skirmish or Mind Finisher, you may place a ‘Small Trap’ in that space, when an enemy moves over a Small Trap their movement is stopped, they’re Slowed, and you may swiftly Skirmish them regardless of range at no Cost, doing this removes the Trap.

flavor: “Just… one… more… step…”
name: Far Setting
text: Your Skirmishes that do not target characters have an additional 3 range. Your Skirmishes that come from “Steel Jaws” Immobilize your target.

flavor: “Just… one… more… step…”
name: Pit Trap
text: If you set a 2 x 2 area of Small Traps you may convert them into a “Pit Trap”, changing the area into Low Terrain and combining the 4 traps into one “Giant Trap”. Giant Traps function identically to Small Traps except they let you use a Mind Finisher on the target instead of a Skirmish.

flavor: The people of the Gardens knew well to put out theirofferings at solstice. For as the days grew long, theHarvesters of Krouses would make pilgrimage, seekinghomes lacking piety to become their bloody crop.
name: Sow
text: After you Skirmish one Character, you may Teleport them to another space adjacent to you. The first time you use this each Turn, you Mark your target.

flavor: The people of the Gardens knew well to put out theirofferings at solstice. For as the days grew long, theHarvesters of Krouses would make pilgrimage, seekinghomes lacking piety to become their bloody crop.
name: Tend
text: Enemies in 3 range don't lose Marked when they’re hit (they still only trigger once per Turn).

flavor: The people of the Gardens knew well to put out theirofferings at solstice. For as the days grew long, theHarvesters of Krouses would make pilgrimage, seekinghomes lacking piety to become their bloody crop.
name: Reap
text: If you start your turn in 5 range of a Marked enemy, you may spend 2 Focus to Teleport to a space adjacent to them and use a Finisher on them at no cost. If you are then in 5 spaces of another Marked enemy, you may repeat this effect at a Focus cost of 1 using a Skirmish instead of a Finisher. This cannot target the same enemy more than once per Turn.

flavor: “Who’s lookin’ to scrap!”
name: Bloody Brass
text: After you Shove a character, Daze them.

flavor: “Who’s lookin’ to scrap!”
name: Break And Bruise
text: If you Skirmish a Dazed character without using a Technique with the Weapon Tag it has Advantage equal to the number of different Effects on your target.

flavor: “Who’s lookin’ to scrap!”
name: Brutalize
text: You may now trigger “Break And Bruise” when targeting Dazed enemies with Body Finishers. The Finishers convert all Advantage from it into additional damage, in addition to Immobilizing and Snaring their target(s) after damage is dealt.

flavor: “Mom always said the best way to move people is withwords, but picking up that bus seemed much faster.”
name: Strong-Arm
text: If you Shove, you may move your target up to 5 spaces in a Line instead of 1 space, pushing any characters it would move through to the nearest possible unoccupied space. If you push them adjacent to an opponent you may Launch all characters involved. You may target Obstacles with your Shoves.

flavor: “Mom always said the best way to move people is withwords, but picking up that bus seemed much faster.”
name: Piston Fist
text: After you Skirmish or Body Finisher a character, you may push them [Body - Target’s Armor] spaces.

flavor: “Mom always said the best way to move people is withwords, but picking up that bus seemed much faster.”
name: Smash Through
text: After you move a character into adjacency with an Obstacle, both take [Body] damage. If the Obstacle is destroyed, the character is pushed for another 3 spaces. This additional movement can only be triggered once per move.

flavor: “I could see them wriggling under his coat, and the glarethrough his glasses didn’t help me feel safer. They triedto explain the mission to me but I could barely payattention, there were times where… something crawledacross the ground out of sight and the conversationwould suddenly stop. It always seemed like it wasglaring at me, despite me not being able to see any of itseyes. I’m getting shivers just thinking about it!”
name: Fluttering Form
text: After you end your turn or are targeted by an attack you may spend 1 Focus to release a “Swarm” in your or the attacker’s space. Swarms are a unique Field, they stop enemies who move into them like Difficult Terrain, deal [Tier] damage to enemies who move into or start their turn in the Field, and can be attacked and destroyed as if they were Obstacles with 1 Health. After you start your Turn you may move each of your Swarms up to 3 spaces.

flavor: “I could see them wriggling under his coat, and the glarethrough his glasses didn’t help me feel safer. They triedto explain the mission to me but I could barely payattention, there were times where… something crawledacross the ground out of sight and the conversationwould suddenly stop. It always seemed like it wasglaring at me, despite me not being able to see any of itseyes. I’m getting shivers just thinking about it!”
name: Vanish Into Flies
text: After you Disappear you may also create 3 Swarms within 2 spaces of the space you left.

flavor: “I could see them wriggling under his coat, and the glarethrough his glasses didn’t help me feel safer. They triedto explain the mission to me but I could barely payattention, there were times where… something crawledacross the ground out of sight and the conversationwould suddenly stop. It always seemed like it wasglaring at me, despite me not being able to see any of itseyes. I’m getting shivers just thinking about it!”
name: Devour
text: When an enemy would take damage from a Swarm while two or more other Swarms are within 2 spaces of it you may remove those additional Swarms from the board to Blight the enemy who took damage and deal [Tier x 2] damage to them.

flavor: “Day 4: I still haven’t seen any of my fellow keepers, itseems we’ve all fallen to the same curse affecting me,this fog goes on forever and strange beasts accost meat every turn. My energy is running low, and I can onlyhope those beasts are edible.”
name: “Where Are You?”
text: While Casting on your Turn You can deal no damage. If you do, this Cast instead banishes a single character within range. Characters you’ve Banished can be targeted, but if they are dealt damage by a non-Banished player character they lose Banished. You may have any number of characters Banished at a time.

flavor: “Day 4: I still haven’t seen any of my fellow keepers, itseems we’ve all fallen to the same curse affecting me,this fog goes on forever and strange beasts accost meat every turn. My energy is running low, and I can onlyhope those beasts are edible.”
name: “Where Am I?”
text: Your first Cast each Turn that uses “Where Are You?” is Swift. If you have two or more enemies banished at the end of your Turn, you may move each of them [Mind] spaces. If two or more of them move adjacent to each other you may force each of them to attack another adjacent enemy.

flavor: “Day 4: I still haven’t seen any of my fellow keepers, itseems we’ve all fallen to the same curse affecting me,this fog goes on forever and strange beasts accost meat every turn. My energy is running low, and I can onlyhope those beasts are edible.”
name: “Who Are They?”
text: If an enemy starts their Turn and all enemies are Banished create two ‘Dark Illusions’. Dark Illusions are NPCS that are always Banished, cannot be targeted or damaged, cannot take Turns, and have one attack that rolls 5 + [Tier] dice and deals damage equal to their hits. They count as enemies for the purpose of using “Where Am I?”.

flavor: “It’s a bit dirty out here for a fight don’t you think? Let'stake this somewhere a little more, orderly.”
name: Gaze Deeply
text: Before you Charge you may forgo the Focus you would gain to Immobilize an enemy in a range equal to the Focus you would have gained.

flavor: “It’s a bit dirty out here for a fight don’t you think? Let'stake this somewhere a little more, orderly.”
name: Domain Of Control
text: Once per Scene after you inflict an Effect to a character you may Teleport them and yourself to any space in your ‘Inner World’ a separate 3x3 board that no other characters have access to. Once you K.O. them or they deal a Wound to you, you Teleport all living characters in your Inner World to a space on the edge of the normal board.

flavor: “It’s a bit dirty out here for a fight don’t you think? Let'stake this somewhere a little more, orderly.”
name: Home Turf
text: While in your Inner World, you gain [Tier] Advantage on all attacks and Duels (this feature carries over to the Duel despite it not being combat). “Domain Of Control” is now [Spirit] times per Scene instead of once per Scene.

flavor: “Look at where you’re standing. Perhaps it’s moreaccurate to say you “were” winning. In the afterlife,practice your situational awareness.”
name: Inscribe
text: After you Breathe, you may place a ‘Rune’ on a space within 4 range. After you Charge you may attempt to connect 3 or more Runes you’ve placed with Lines to form a polygon, and then Spirit or Mind Finisher targeting all spaces in this polygon (including its lines) at no cost, this removes the Runes.

flavor: “Look at where you’re standing. Perhaps it’s moreaccurate to say you “were” winning. In the afterlife,practice your situational awareness.”
name: Readjust
text: Before connecting the lines when using “Inscribe” you may Teleport any/all of your Runes up to 3 spaces in any direction.

flavor: “Look at where you’re standing. Perhaps it’s moreaccurate to say you “were” winning. In the afterlife,practice your situational awareness.”
name: Prison Of Your Own Design
text: After you use the Charge portion of “Inscribe” you may leave the lines on the board until you next use it. The spaces these Lines cover are Difficult Terrain for opponents.

flavor: “Explosion!”
name: Explosion!!
text: Your Spirit Finisher can now target a space in 4 Range and all spaces adjacent to it instead of its normal targeting.

flavor: “Explosion!”
name: Explosion!!!
text: If you spend 2 or more Focus on a Spirit Finisher, you may have it target a 3x3 Zone centered on a space within 5 range.

flavor: “Explosion!”
name: EXPLOSION!!!!
text: If you spend 4 or more Focus on a Spirit Finisher, you may have it target a 5x5 Zone centered on a space within 6 range.

flavor: “No, No, NO! Try showing me up when reduced to ash!”
name: Proliferate
text: Before you Cast or Spirit Finisher, you may spend 1 Focus to ‘Rapid Fire’ instead. While Rapid Firing, you roll damage before targeting (meaning you cannot be affected by things that apply advantage / disadvantage when targeting) and may divide all damage dealt between any spaces or characters within 5 range. You don't need to divide this damage equally.

flavor: “No, No, NO! Try showing me up when reduced to ash!”
name: Scorched Earth
text: After you deal damage to an empty space, you may turn it into Difficult Terrain. The first time enemies move into or start their Turn in Difficult Terrain you created each Turn, they receive [Tier] damage.

flavor: “No, No, NO! Try showing me up when reduced to ash!”
name: Endless Fire [ Charge → Cast ]
text: The Cast gains Advantage equal to the number of different enemies you could target + [Tension].

flavor: “Glyphs intertwine, paths converge—within thismesmerizing dance of foci, magic fnds purpose.” i
name: Ley Lines
text: After you Charge you may place a ‘Spell Circle’ in your current space, removing any you’ve already created. When in a Spell Circle space, your Spirit Finishers can target enemies in 5 range.

flavor: “Glyphs intertwine, paths converge—within thismesmerizing dance of foci, magic fnds purpose.” i
name: Arcane Artillery
text: When affected by a Spell Circle, your first Spirit Finisher each Turn has 3 additional range and gains [Tension] Advantage.

flavor: “Glyphs intertwine, paths converge—within thismesmerizing dance of foci, magic fnds purpose.” i
name: Fractal Etchings
text: If you Charge while on a Spell Circle, you may enhance it for the Scene, doubling the effects of “Arcane Artillery”. A Spell Circle can't be enhanced multiple times.

flavor: “Why so glum, you’re living in hallowed times! I’ve evengraced you with my presence! Enjoy it while you can!”
name: All Eyes On Me
text: Once per Action, after you roll a Crit for any reason, you may spend 1 AP or 3 Focus to ‘Elevate’ the roll. If you Elevate, describe how your character adds some dramatic flair or additional detail to the roll they’re taking and increase the Tension by 1.

flavor: “Why so glum, you’re living in hallowed times! I’ve evengraced you with my presence! Enjoy it while you can!”
name: Snatch Their Fire
text: If you increase Tension, create ‘Drama’ instead. Drama increases Tension by it’s value on player’s Turns, being turned back into Drama on enemy Turns.

flavor: “Why so glum, you’re living in hallowed times! I’ve evengraced you with my presence! Enjoy it while you can!”
name: Power In Presentation
text:
After you Elevate specific actions, they receive a bonus:
‣ Finisher: Deal [Tension] additional damage (counting the Tension added via Elevate).
‣ Charge: Gain AP equal to the AP spent on this Action (not including AP spent on Elevate).
‣ Cast: You may Mark, Immobilize, Taunt, or Fear your target, if multiple Crits were rolled choose one additional option for each Crit.

flavor: “Magic isn’t a thing you own, you don’t create it and youaren't its master. The magi borrow from somethinggreater than themselves, it's only natural that I return thefavor once in a while.”
name: Vorpal Claw
text: Your Cast can now only target one character within 2 range and Snares the target, this overrides any range or targeting modifiers or replacements outside this Technique. You may Roll Body instead of Spirit for Cast’s Roll.

flavor: “Magic isn’t a thing you own, you don’t create it and youaren't its master. The magi borrow from somethinggreater than themselves, it's only natural that I return thefavor once in a while.”
name: Unchain [ Charge → Interact]
text: If Interact targets you, begin tracking ‘Fury’ a 6 Segment Clock, and fill one Segment for each adjacent enemy + [Tension]. If you have Fury Segments, you can only spend AP on Jumps & Finishers, and doing either empties one. In Fury, Jumps are Swift, and after you Jump Swiftly Cast at no Cost targeting ALL adjacent targets. When Fury empties, remove it, and you’re Dazed.

flavor: “Magic isn’t a thing you own, you don’t create it and youaren't its master. The magi borrow from somethinggreater than themselves, it's only natural that I return thefavor once in a while.”
name: Grasp
text: Your Casts gain 1 Advantage. If you have at least 1 Fury Segment and you use a Body Finisher, you may spend all your Fury Segments to gain [Tension] Advantage and move up to 3 spaces before targeting.

flavor: It started from the extremities furthest from his heart.Beat by beat, Otes lost feeling in his fingers and toes.After legs came his sight, he must rely on his instinct.And finally it enveloped him, a dark blessing, a grimperversion of the natural world, an immoral exploitationof his masters, and the only chance he had left.
name: Impermanent Power
text: Once per Scene, after you Charge or Awaken this with at least 2 Tension, you may ‘Transform’, gaining 1 AP, pushing all enemies within 2 range 3 spaces away, and losing Health until you reach 1, gaining the Health lost + [Spirit] in Focus. While you’re Transformed the first Cast of your Turn is Swift and Health loss / gain affects your Focus instead. After you are reduced to 0 Focus while Transformed, you lose the Transformation and become Dazed.

flavor: It started from the extremities furthest from his heart.Beat by beat, Otes lost feeling in his fingers and toes.After legs came his sight, he must rely on his instinct.And finally it enveloped him, a dark blessing, a grimperversion of the natural world, an immoral exploitationof his masters, and the only chance he had left.
name: Drain Life
text: After you use a Spirit Finisher while transformed, you may begin ‘Draining’ your target, Immobilizing yourself and the target until the start of either of your next Turns, if neither of you take damage before the effect is lost you gain [Spirit] Focus.

flavor: It started from the extremities furthest from his heart.Beat by beat, Otes lost feeling in his fingers and toes.After legs came his sight, he must rely on his instinct.And finally it enveloped him, a dark blessing, a grimperversion of the natural world, an immoral exploitationof his masters, and the only chance he had left.
name: Umbra
text: After you lose your Transformation, you may use a Spirit Finisher targeting yourself and enemies in a 3x3 Zone centered on yourself. If you’re Tier 3 or higher you may Daze yourself and spend 2 Focus to transform as soon as you deploy regardless of Tension.

flavor: “Eros, a $20k compound bow custom-made for easydisassembly and shots from a distance upwards of 2000meters. It boasts a draw of 200 lbs and the ability topierce military grade armor. It’s Mayflower’s calling card,and one of the few things that proves they ever existed.”
name: Nock The Arrow
text: Gain a new Action, ‘Prepare’. Prepare costs 1 AP, is Swift, and gives you one ‘Prep’. Once per Turn, Before you Skirmish or Talent Finisher, spend your Prep to gain 2 additional range & Advantage for each Prep spent, up to a maximum of 6 Prep.

flavor: “Eros, a $20k compound bow custom-made for easydisassembly and shots from a distance upwards of 2000meters. It boasts a draw of 200 lbs and the ability topierce military grade armor. It’s Mayflower’s calling card,and one of the few things that proves they ever existed.”
name: Feather Step
text: After you Prepare, you may move one space so long as you don't move adjacent to an enemy.

flavor: “Eros, a $20k compound bow custom-made for easydisassembly and shots from a distance upwards of 2000meters. It boasts a draw of 200 lbs and the ability topierce military grade armor. It’s Mayflower’s calling card,and one of the few things that proves they ever existed.”
name: Lord Piercer [ Prepare × 3 ]
text: Gain 1 AP, your next Skirmish or Finisher this Scene (can’t stack) targets all characters in an adjacent Line with a length equal to its range. If said Attack targets a character at the attack’s maximum Range or the edge of the board, the attack deals additional damage equal to the Prep spent.

flavor: “You’ve been told you’re hard to notice, easy to ignore.If only they knew how right they were.”
name: Return To Nothing
text: The first time you Dodge, are Banished, or move to the edge of the board each Round, you can spend 1 Focus to Teleport to another space on the edge of the board.

flavor: “You’ve been told you’re hard to notice, easy to ignore.If only they knew how right they were.”
name: Fade Away
text: The spaces on the edge of the board and adjacent to enemies are always valid places to Teleport to or return to from being Disappeared.

flavor: “You’ve been told you’re hard to notice, easy to ignore.If only they knew how right they were.”
name: Hollow Heart
text: Begin tracking ‘Void’, a 4 Segment Clock that’s emptied after every Scene. After you Teleport, become Banished, or Disappear fill one Segment on your Clock, after you Teleport adjacent to an enemy while the Clock is filled you may empty the clock to ‘Drown’ a character adjacent to you, Banishing both of you and letting you Spirit Finisher them at no Cost. You cannot fill the Void Clock on the same Turn you Drown a character.

flavor: “Plenty of kids in this country have spent sleeplessnights watching the White Hounds, sparks flying downmountains and trees, descending from the clouds.Inevitably they’ll be told by those older and wiser thatthere’s no such thing, and when I was that age I almostlistened. Thank god I didn’t, the wind against my face isso exhilarating at this height.”
name: Raiden
text: Begin tracking ‘Static’, a 6 Segment Clock that’s emptied after each Scene. If you roll more Hits on a roll than you have Segments, Hasten yourself and fill a Segment, or two segments if at least one of those rolls were a Crit. After you fill this clock, empty it, Daze yourself, and Swiftly Cast targeting all enemies within 4 range.

flavor: “Plenty of kids in this country have spent sleeplessnights watching the White Hounds, sparks flying downmountains and trees, descending from the clouds.Inevitably they’ll be told by those older and wiser thatthere’s no such thing, and when I was that age I almostlistened. Thank god I didn’t, the wind against my face isso exhilarating at this height.”
name: Energized Incantation
text:
After you Cast, you can empty a Static Segment to do one of the following:
‣ Blink: Teleport to a space adjacent to your target
‣ Shock: Inflict Daze.
‣ Chain: Swiftly Cast a different enemy in 5 range of initial target at no cost (this cannot spend static).

flavor: “Plenty of kids in this country have spent sleeplessnights watching the White Hounds, sparks flying downmountains and trees, descending from the clouds.Inevitably they’ll be told by those older and wiser thatthere’s no such thing, and when I was that age I almostlistened. Thank god I didn’t, the wind against my face isso exhilarating at this height.”
name: Tactical Discharge
text: While you have at least 3 Static, Your Casts Crit on 5s or 6s. If you fill your Static Clock by casting or using a Spirit Finisher you may Teleport to a space within 4 range before emptying it.

flavor: “This city is a heretical idol, incomplete, unstable, andfallen to vice. My men and I have tried to negotiate itssalvation, but these creatures seem unable to savethemselves. Be thankful we are so graceful.”
name: Forming Signs
text: You now use ‘Creation Marks’ instead of Focus. You start all Scenes with no Marks. You can only gain Marks using Breathe and Charge. If you make an attack with any number of Creation Marks you must spend all of them and gain an effect based on the number spent and the Attack used. 1-2 & Cast: Crossing Nails: Target two adjacent 3 space Lines where at least 1 space of each overlaps. 3+ & Cast: Impossible Mallet: Target every enemy exactly 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 spaces away from you, dealing additional damage equal to this number. 1-2 & Finisher: Celestial Pile-Arm: Gain 2 Advantage. Your target is pushed as far as possible, and receives one damage for every space pushed 3+ & Finisher: Living Idol Gain 4 Advantage. Target up to 6 spaces adjacent to each other where one is adjacent to you, these spaces also become high-ground.

flavor: “This city is a heretical idol, incomplete, unstable, andfallen to vice. My men and I have tried to negotiate itssalvation, but these creatures seem unable to savethemselves. Be thankful we are so graceful.”
name: One True World
text: Your first Breath you use on your turn is Swift, your Charge has its cost reduced to 1. After you deal damage to or destroy an Obstacle you gain a Creation Mark.

flavor: “This city is a heretical idol, incomplete, unstable, andfallen to vice. My men and I have tried to negotiate itssalvation, but these creatures seem unable to savethemselves. Be thankful we are so graceful.”
name: Labor Of The Devout [ Cast → Finisher ]
text: This Finisher counts as having spent an equal amount of Creation Marks as the Cast used before it.

flavor: “Everyone thinks an idiot of an innovator.”
name: Experimentation
text:
Gain one of the ‘Augments’ listed below. You start every Scene with [Mind] ‘Innovation’ charges, and may spend one of those charges before you Cast or use a Spirit Finisher to apply an Augment you have. These bonuses are as follows:
‣ Dire Augment: Damage dealt by this attack is increased by [Mind].
‣ Focused Augment: This attack now targets a 5 space Line adjacent to you.
‣ Wild Augment: This attack now targets a 2x2 Zone within 3 range.
‣ Salient Augment: The range, and the length of lines created by this attack, are increased by [Mind].

flavor: “Everyone thinks an idiot of an innovator.”
name: Solidification
text: Gain an additional Augment. You no longer have Innovation charges and may use Experimentation by spending 1 Focus, your starting Focus is increased by [Mind].

flavor: “Everyone thinks an idiot of an innovator.”
name: Finalization
text: Gain an additional Augment. You may apply two different Augments to any Cast or Finisher so long as you pay for both.

flavor: “Feel the power flow into you, the ears ring with popsand snaps, the forearms go numb and the feet arerooted, with the earth below being your last resort incase everything else goes wrong. Remember yourteachings and chants, only when every single one failswill you really know what you’re capable of.”
name: Power Unleashed [ Charge → Finisher ]
text: The Finisher has its Cost reduced to 1. While you use this Finisher, you spend up to triple the Tension in Focus.

flavor: “Feel the power flow into you, the ears ring with popsand snaps, the forearms go numb and the feet arerooted, with the earth below being your last resort incase everything else goes wrong. Remember yourteachings and chants, only when every single one failswill you really know what you’re capable of.”
name: Formless Strength
text: If you use “Power Unleashed” you can have it target a ∞ length Line or a 2x2 space Zone adjacent to you.

flavor: “Feel the power flow into you, the ears ring with popsand snaps, the forearms go numb and the feet arerooted, with the earth below being your last resort incase everything else goes wrong. Remember yourteachings and chants, only when every single one failswill you really know what you’re capable of.”
name: Moment Of Truth
text: If you enter a Duel with 6 or more Focus you may expend all of it to gain Advantage in that Duel equal to half the Focus you spent.

flavor: “What approached me in that moon-lit pavilion was noelf, the way their eyes glowed was unnatural, the flamesthat licked from the ground to their legs, it felt toopracticed, and the way they bled looked almost like theywanted this to happen.”
name: Rev Up
text: After you Breathe you may ‘Ignite’, receiving up to 6 damage and Blighting yourself to receive an additional Focus for every 2 damage taken. You receive half the damage from Blight.

flavor: “What approached me in that moon-lit pavilion was noelf, the way their eyes glowed was unnatural, the flamesthat licked from the ground to their legs, it felt toopracticed, and the way they bled looked almost like theywanted this to happen.”
name: Damning Impact
text: If you Cast or use a Spirit Finisher while Blighted, you gain [Tension] Advantage, and Blight your target. If you would Blight an enemy who’s already Blighted you deal [Tier] damage.

flavor: “What approached me in that moon-lit pavilion was noelf, the way their eyes glowed was unnatural, the flamesthat licked from the ground to their legs, it felt toopracticed, and the way they bled looked almost like theywanted this to happen.”
name: Ashes To Ashes
text: Your Casts gain 1 Advantage. Your Spirit Finisher has a range of 5 and removes Blight from its target and yourself after targeting, if it removes any Blight it additionally targets enemies in two crossing diagonal 5 space Lines centered on the target in the shape of an “X”.

flavor: “Each incantation is a flurry of frozen elegance,conjuring storms of ice and swirls of snow.”
name: Chill
text: Your successful Casts Slow your target(s).

flavor: “Each incantation is a flurry of frozen elegance,conjuring storms of ice and swirls of snow.”
name: Icicle Halo
text: Your Casts gain 1 Advantage. Begin tracking “Icicle”, a 4 Segment Clock that empties after each Scene. Once per Action, after you gain Focus, fill one Segment. Before you Breathe you may replace its effect with emptying the Clock and deal [Spirit/2] damage to a character within 5 range once for each Segment emptied. If this damage targets a Slow character, Immobilize them.

flavor: “Each incantation is a flurry of frozen elegance,conjuring storms of ice and swirls of snow.”
name: Shatter
text: Your Spirit Finishers can target enemies in 5 range. After you use a Finisher on an Immobilized character, the Narrator must tell you their Health, if their Health is equal to or lower than [Spirit] you knock them out. After you KO a character using “Shatter”, Slow enemies within 3 spaces of the target.

flavor: “My spirit was focused, ready. I have honed it into asharpness few things have ever known. It is almostdisappointing that most will only see it once.”
name: Call Arms
text: Choose a Technique with the “Weapon” Tag that you don't have, it’s added to your ‘Arsenal’. After you Breathe or Charge, you may ‘Forge’ a number of Techniques from your ‘Arsenal’ equal to the focus gained. If you Cast with a Forged Technique, you must use one to gain the 1st level of that Technique for the cast and make it count as a Cast and a Skirmish.

flavor: “My spirit was focused, ready. I have honed it into asharpness few things have ever known. It is almostdisappointing that most will only see it once.”
name: Blade Storm
text: Add a weapon to your Arsenal. After you start your Turn with 2 or more Forged Techniques, Strengthen yourself and make your first Cast Swift.

flavor: “My spirit was focused, ready. I have honed it into asharpness few things have ever known. It is almostdisappointing that most will only see it once.”
name: Saintly Sword, Excalibur
text: Add a weapon to your Arsenal. If you Spirit Finisher while Strengthened, it targets an enemy within 5 spaces, can use “Call Arms”, provides all three levels of the Technique chosen, and counts as a Body / Talent AND Spirit Finisher.

flavor: The Keepers of Lear had some of the strangest partners.The Faeries rarely take the shape of elves, seeming toprefer hounds and rodents. Their reputation for violenceis worse than those animals they imitate.
name: A Warrior’s Reprise
text: Your Casts gain 2 Advantage. Before you Cast without a ‘Sellsword’ marker, first create one in a space within [Spirit] range. Your Casts only treat spaces adjacent to your Sellsword as being within range. If you move while you have a Sellsword you may move them the same distance.

flavor: The Keepers of Lear had some of the strangest partners.The Faeries rarely take the shape of elves, seeming toprefer hounds and rodents. Their reputation for violenceis worse than those animals they imitate.
name: Warrior’s Fury
text: Once per Round, after you gain Focus, while you have a Sellsword, you may use this to move it [Spirit] spaces and ‘Spark’ a character adjacent to your Sellsword 1/2/3/4 times, based on if you gained at least 1/3/6/10 Focus. A Spark deals [Spirit / 2] damage to its target and counts as a Swift Cast; features other than this Technique cannot change a Spark’s targeting or damage.

flavor: The Keepers of Lear had some of the strangest partners.The Faeries rarely take the shape of elves, seeming toprefer hounds and rodents. Their reputation for violenceis worse than those animals they imitate.
name: Supreme Sellsword
text: As you end your Turn you may spend 6 Focus to replace your Sellsword with a Summoned DPS NPC of your choice at the same Tier as you placed in the closest unoccupied space. At the start of your next Turn it turns back into a Sellsword in the same space.

flavor: “The brass has sullied all we hold sacred! The machineis in the garden, and nectar coats its teeth!”
name: Heretical Devotion
text: Begin tracking ‘Insight’, a 6 Segment Clock that’s emptied after each Scene. Once per Action, after you roll a 1 for any reason, you may spend 1 Focus to fill an Insight Segment. If you Charge, Cast, or Spirit Finisher, you may empty an Insight Segment to have your final Hit count treated as [Spirit + Tier] x 2 minus the number of Hits rolled.

flavor: “The brass has sullied all we hold sacred! The machineis in the garden, and nectar coats its teeth!”
name: Freak
text: After you start your Turn with 4 or more Insight Segments filled, you may Strengthen yourself and have every character inflict Fear on you.

flavor: “The brass has sullied all we hold sacred! The machineis in the garden, and nectar coats its teeth!”
name: Never Meant To Be
text: If you use a Spirit Finisher with a full Insight Clock, you may empty all the Segments to have it target two intersecting ∞ length lines anywhere on the board. All characters targeted are moved one space off of the line in a direction of your choice and the targeted spaces are removed from the game, destroying any Obstacle on them or connected to them. If a character would enter one of these spaces, they are instead Teleported to the closest space on the opposite side of the Line.

flavor: Two minds as one, united in a pursuit of glory.
name: I Am Your Sword
text: After Deploying or Breathing adjacent to a willing ally you may ‘Transform’, making them your ‘Wielder’. While Transformed you take up your Wielder’s space, you can use their attributes for rolls, other characters can’t willingly target or damage you, and you can’t move. If your Wielder takes a Wound you do too. Either of you can split at the start of your Turns, placing you in an unoccupied adjacent space.

flavor: Two minds as one, united in a pursuit of glory.
name: Show Your Targets
text: You may move on your Turn while transformed, moving your Wielder with you.

flavor: Two minds as one, united in a pursuit of glory.
name: And I’ll Become Irreplaceable
text: After you transform, determine you and your wielder’s highest combined Attribute (choosing between ties), and give both of you a feature based on what it is; Body: Heavy Arm: Before targeting with Finishers move up to 3 spaces in a Line, dealing [Partner’s Body] damage to enemies you move adjacent to. Talent: Bladed Arm: When moving you ignore enemies and gain [Partner’s Talent] Evasion if you moved through at least one enemy. Spirit: Ranged Arm: Your Finishers can target characters up to [Partner’s Spirit] spaces away, when they target one character at that range exactly they also deal [Your Spirit] additional damage. Mind: Complex Arm: At the end of your Turn Mark all enemies you attacked, after you attack a Marked enemy gain [Partner’s Mind] Focus.
